11411121111.title: First day

choices: Nel begins the search for the genie's lamp with Suzie and Miriam
Suzie and Miriam capture Nel to study her and find out what makes pixies tick.
Nel has second thoughts and will not go with the two girls.
1142.content:
Nel defiantly opted to seek out the genie lamp in spite of the warnings she had heard. She quickly thanked the stranger for the help and rapidly moved away. "I'm not sure where I'm headed but being with that stranger was strange," she thought. She flew in the first direction her small wings took her. Below she spotted a green grassy place and landed delicately on a bench placed beside a small body of water. "Now this more like it. Looks like home where I can sit quietly and think without disturbance." She began to think.

Her alone time was interrupted when she saw two human girls coming toward her on the path beside the water. "Oh oh," she thought, "what do I do now. I'm small but not invisible. It's too late to move out of sight as they are here in front or me." So, Nel sat very still.

"What is that on the bench? It's small and has bright colors on it." One girl stepped closer. "It looks like a teensy weensy human with wings. How precious!"

"I don't know what it is," reported the second girl, "but it seems to be alert and alive. Can you talk?" She directed the question to the oject on the bench.

Nel was surprised to be addressed by the human but responded, "Of course I can talk. I'm a Pixie and proud to be one even though I'd like to be much bigger."

"Well, that's a fine howdy do," the first girl said. "Is there anything we can do to help? We like to help others - that's what we do best." She smiled at her friend who was nodding in agreement.

"Suzie's right," the second girl said, "and we know a lot about this city so we probably can be helpful."

"Umm, I met a stranger who told me there is supposed to be a genie's lamp here somewhere," Nel said. "Would you be able to help me find it?"

"I dont know. Miriam," she addressed the second girl, "would you know anything about that?"

Miriam scratched her head while Nel looked on. Then she smiled and looked directly at Nel. "I do know a very talented magician here in town. If anyone would know about a magic genie lamp, she would."

"Can you take me to her?," Nel asked with pleading in her voice.

"I think that can easily be arranged. But first, tell me your name."

"I am Nel of a little-known forest. This is my first time to a big city,. It's quite overwhelming, you know - so big and all."

Both girls looked sympathetic and nodded. Suzie spoke: "Nel, I can imagine how it is all very peculiar to you. I have two questions for you."

"Yes," Nel said.

"How do you think finding the magic lamp, if there even is such a thing, will help you? And, if Miriam is going to take us to her magician friend, can we pick you up and carry you?"

Nel pondered a moment, "I'm hoping that I can use the magic lamp to become bigger because, in my world, bigger is better. You see, the biggest pixies have the most power and therefore the best opportunities."

Both girls nodded as they listened attentively to her.

"As to being carried," Nel continued, "it is possible and probably, under the circumstances, would be the least obvious way for me to get places. I'm sure many humans would be overly curious or otherwise distracting from my purpose, if you know what I mean."

The two girls smiled knowingly at one another. "You're right about that," Miriam chuckled. "We have lots of 'bad apples' here in this city. Best that you hang with us."

Under her breath, Nel whispered, "I hope this is the right thing to do." Aloud she said, :"I don't mean to rush you, but when can we start?"

Suzie looked at Miram. Both girls shrugged. "Why not start now?" they said.
1142.title: In search of the genie's lamp

choices: Crystal is home and cordially invites them in.
Crystal is not home and the girls must decide what to do next.
11421.content:
Saying that, Suzie leaned over the gently picked Nel up and placed her in a small shallow pocket on the front of her dress. Nel's head poked up above the edge of the pocket.

"This gives me a fine view of everything, yet I can duck down and be invisible if I need to," Nel commented.

"That was my plan," replied Suzie. "Now, let's be going." She and Miriam started off at a brisk walk. "Where exactly are we going?" she asked Miriam.

"To the old part of town where colorful chacters live. Crystal, the magician I know about, lives there but sometimes makes trips to practice her arts for groups of children at parties or other events. She has a special salon she uses when people visit her home. I was there once with my 'Interesting Arts through the Ages' class. She's an odd sort but appears to have real talent though I know much of what most magicians do is fake."

The girls strutted along. Nel watched things whiz by almost fast enough to make her dizzy. She listened intently to their chatter.

"That must have been an interesting field trip, Miriam. How did you happen to take that class?"

"I thought it would be interesting and it was. We saw and did lots of things I had not done before..."

Her comments were interrupted when a group of three older men were approaching them from the opposite direction.

"Nel, duck down," Suzie commanded and, instantly, Nel disappeared into the pocket.

"It's a pleasant day for a long walk," Miriam said to Suzie as the men came even with them on the pathway.

"Yes, it is," Suzie replied, "and we are moving right along. Our health coaches will be proud of us."

Then they were beyond the men who had, gratefully, paid them no heed. Both girls resisted the temptation to look back to see what the men were doing. They kept walking briskly and bantering 'nothings' back and forth until it was clear that no one was noticing.

"Okay, Nel, you can pop up again. We weren't sure what would happen if those men stopped us or tried to talk with us."

"How much further do we have to go?" Nel asked.

"Not much further now," Miriam stated, We just cross the stream on the little bridge and wander into the old part of town. I think I can find her place."

"Oh great," Suzie cried. "Now you tell us you 'think' you can find her place....this Crystal person. What if you can't?"

"Relax, Suzie. I can and will find it. Don't you worry about that. Let's just keep going."

They were soon into an area filled with large old homes close together, so close sometimes the sunlight was blocked completely. While such a spot could have felt oppressing, it had a 'lighter' quality about it.

"How can it be so dark here and still feel so light," Nel asked from her place in the pocket.

"I think there's some general special magic here," Miriam replied. "Let me see now, we turn here and go another block..."

They walked along quietly.

"Now we turn here and Crystal's place is on the next corner I believe."

"I hope you're right," Suzie said. "My feet are starting to hurt. I need to sit down."

"I'm excited. Will Crystal know about the genie's lamp?" Nel was practically jumping up and down in Suzie's pocket.

"I don't know, but if anyone in this city would know, she would be the one. We'll keep our fingers crossed."

"Yes, this is the place," Miriam continued, "I remember the bright red front door and the elegant gold door pull."

"Door pull?" Nel asked.

"It's a way to ring something inside the house. A bit like a door bell but more splendid." The three of them ascended the brick stairs to the front door of the three story building.

"Let me tug the pull," Suzie requested.

"Be my guest," Miriam said, stepping aside to allow Suzie access to the golden cord. After Suzie pulled it, the three heard a muffled sound from inside the house and then waited expectantly.


.

Nel looked in shock as her dress slowly continued to grow around her. The bottle, which she was once bigger than even after her first shrink, now was almost the size of herself, and growing larger in height! Nel was always tiny for a pixie, but now she felt like a pixie in a human's house in her own home! Nel sat on the table and frustration and began to cry as she shrank further and further.

Eventually the tiny Nel was now barely over quarter of an inch tall, shrunk dwn to 1/16 her normal height! The dress was not only too big for the little pixie, but was big enough to be a blanket for a king-sized bed. Noticing the bottle was still open, Nel wondered whether or not to simply fly into the bottle already and simply hope for the best. Before doing so, though, she noticed a knock on the door.

"Hello?" the voice asked. Nel knew the voice anywhere: it was Clare! Clare was already almost five times Nel's height, but now she would be almost 80 to the little pixie. Nel flew behind the big bottle as Clare opened the door and let herself in. Upon doing so she noticed Nel's dress on the table, but did not see her friend (Nel flew out of the dress naked). It didn't take long for Clare to find her behind the bottle.

"Nel!?!" yelled in confusion the tall pixie. "Why are so small, even more than usual?!"

"This bottle's contents made me shrink", Nel explained to her gigantic friend, crying in frustration. "And now I'm super tiny."

"There, there", Clare told her friend, giving her a tissue to wipe her tears with, which Nel was grateful for. "Don't worry your little head. I know someone who can help you return to normal, and I know where he lives."

"Where?" asked Nel, feeling a little more cheerful.

"Why, the pixie elder in the magic forest!" Clare smiled.

"B-b-but Clare, we can't enter there", Nel tried to explain to her tall pixie friend. "It's off-limits."

"Don't worry, Nel, I'll go for you and head on back with an antidote", Clare told the Nel, giving the girl a playful head rub with pinky finger. "I'll be back soon. You stay here and stay put."

"Thank you so much", Nel smiled, bowing her head in gratitude to her friend. "I won't ever forge this. After this make all the short jokes you want."

"Will do, Alice" Clare giggled as she left Nel's house and closed the door. Nel proceeded to get back into her dress, as she was getting cold. Fortunately, it made a nice blanket.

Wrapped up in her dress like a blanket, cowering at the height of things that even she was once taller then, Nel was a very worried girl at that moment. It's not that she minded being rescued by Clare, it's just that she wished she was big enough to solve her own problems. Even when they were little, Clare looked over the much littler Nel like a big sister, even though the two couldn't be any less related. At the same time Nel was also jealous of her friend. Clare was tall, pretty, and smart: most every male pixie their age had, at one point in time, a crush on the powerful pixie. Nel simply sighed to herself and went to sleep in her own dress.

The over 300 feet tall, almost straightly vertical rock walls surrounding the cove made it impossible to go ashore anywhere, and because of the more than often appearing dragons many fish had left it. So only a madman would fish there. But some madmen knew the tricks on how to do it anyways.
His master had studied the valley and had learned a secret. Even thought there only were a few 100 feet down from the waters surface to the bottom and no fish ever in sight, he had found a way to find a living from the placer anyway. By throwing a certain chum the old fisher had prepared down into the dephts, the unique Flamehead Mackerel would surface from their caves underneath (whom hardly any besides himself and his master knew of), and swarm out of the cove. From there on you simply had to throw a normal fence-net into the water and the fleeing fish would be an easy catch. He sure had a wise master

That day it had been a fine catch. Hordes of the Flameheads had swam into their nets. They had already gotten hold of 2 batches. However on the third quite the anomality had taken place. Suddenly no fish would come up, even after to whole bottles of chum had been dispatched of. Annoyed the master had walked back to the ship to get the "special chum" which would be sure to lure them out. As the master began to bumble about in the back of the ship, the young fisher had taken a deep breath while looking at the sea horizon. Then suddenly the entire boat shaked as massive quakes were heard. Now the Flameheads surfaced and fled the canyon in greater numbers than he had ever seen on his 100 trips. They did not concern him now however. He rushed to the other side of the boat to inspect the source of the quakes. Perhaps a crash on the cliff?
When he came there the first thing he saw was his master, who had fallen down. Proberbly from a heart attack from the shock of the sudden chaos. Then he saw the odd thing. His master had just had a grand nosebleed. It looked like the same kind like the ones he had when he saw a bit too skanky dressed young girl. His first thought was the dirty thought of bikine dressed girls playing with bombs at the cliffs, and he quickly turned his head to disapprove of that theory, and find the true answear.

His theory WAS disproved. However not entirely. Instead the image was far,FAR stranger than what he had expected. There, 300 feet up on the cliffs stood a, not big, not giant but positively colossal (and arguebly the most curvaceous woman he had ever seen. For a second he stood and admired the sight in awe. The girl had wings, but she was far too large (and far too humane-looking) to be a dragon of any kind. Her body was extrodinaryli sexy, breasts the size of farms, legs that could have fitted a ideal model, and a bottom with the most perfect shape he had ever seen. And her very form was so enormous that it blotted out the sun for the small boat, leaving them in her massive shadow. He looked blindly in shock as the giant fairy (as he guessed it must've been with those wings, even though her size was far beyond that of any faire, or fairy village in general) carefully descended her legs into the water, the surface hardly barely reaching half way up to her knees. Then suddenly her face gained an expression of suprise, as she began to study and feel the seafloor with her feet.
He used this to snap back to reality, and figure out a solution to this (likely) dangerous situation. He quickly grabbed his old master, threw him over the shoulder and ran with him into the cabin, were he placed him on a matress they had lying around. He then quickly got out, and looked at the giantess, now finding her to having gotten onto her knees, and studying the seafloor with his hands. He ran onto the stearing deck, and quickly began turning on the engine. To his misfortune, the engine was unruly and had a hard time getting up. Stressed, he raised his hands and delivered a mighty blow to it. That was inarguebly the biggest mistake he had ever, given the situation. The engines chimney gave up a large explosion as it spat out a pitch dark cloud, and then stared to bumble, ready to go. The young fisher raised his heads to the giantess, who, as he had guessed, curiously stared at the boat, and most likely him. He quickly turned the roar to full turn, and the engine to full speed. Suddenly the giant womans expression changed to a joyful smile, as she rose to her full height. She then rose her left leg high into the air, roughly at the same time the boat reached a direction in which it could flee the scene. But before they moved more than a few feet, the girl trampled her feet into the seafloor below, making a mighty wave. The fisher saw that the girl broke the seafloor, revealing more fleeing Flameheads than he had ever seen in his LIFETIME. The waves grew as the water that had been trapped in the caves blew up, and in an instant sank turned the ship into a chaotic scene. In the rumble, the fisher hit his head on a uknown object and then passed out.

The fisherman woke up. After getting to himself and thinking the situation through he quicly noticed that the boat, greatly smashed and wrecked were no longer in water, but rather on solid ground. Had the wave washed them ashore. Whatever had happened he quikcly knew he had to get his teacher to civilisation. He rushed down, grabbed the old man and ascended the cabin. What met him when he got up left im petrified. The solid ground the ship was placed on had turned out to be the girls hand, easily holding their small boat in her palm, and once he had climbed the final step the giant womans face had met him with a happy smile. He looked down and saw that the girl, now stood in the water with the surface reaching buttheight (the cavesystem had to have been massive underground). She then carefully placed the boat on a cliffside, still facing the paralyzed sailor at her face. He watched as she quickly filled her mouth with air, and with a small blow (giant to him) blew him off the boat, and let him fly across the forest, still holding his master. He bumbled into a treetop, now once again passing out from the motion, shock and general overwhelment of the strange events.

Now....

It wasn't their natural element. Clare had only tried it ones, ages ago. Meanwhile, as she struggled to get the fire running, with her small pile of debris, the long haired, orange glowing freak were floating around in circles above her, observing as she struggled. "Will you help me, or just keep being useless up there" Clare yelled.
"Oh im perfectly warm up here. Superior existance, remember?" the man said gleefully. With a great sigh, Clare managed to make a force a push of magic from her hands into the debris, and much to her joy, a fire rose. "Oohh, the monkey learned to spell" The man said, as he broke out in a short hysterical laugh over his own, weak humour.

He had identified himself Raziel. He had told her that he was a god of size, and that he was repsonsible for the last few hours of trouble. Clare had just judged him a crazy wizard. But she approved of that once he shrank himself to the size of an ant. For fairies. So small she could've squashed him with her hands, just to grow human big again, and laugh at her. As Clare sat down to get some warmth, Raziel shrank down to her size level, and sat on the opposite side of the bonfire, and smiled into it, with a mad look in his eyes. It was akward for a few seconds to see him like that. Then Clare broke the silence:
"What did you do to us, anyways?" She asked. Raziel lifted his eyes towards her, with a curious expression on his face. His smile then returned as he answeared.
"To her" He said.
"Pardon me?" Said Clare
"It was only mean't for your friend. The one who is big now, remember?" he said sarcastically. Clare showed an angry expression, before she continued to question him
"What was only mean't for Nel then?" she asked
"The water" he said silently
"You mean the potion?" Clare proceeded.
"It was just water. I was in one of the drops, at the size of an atom wathcing her. She whined and whined over her size, and as the god of size i heard her prayers. They annoyed me, so i decided to punish her by making her smaller, and it worked. Right until you came along". Raziel explained.
"What do you mean? What did i do?" Clare asked frustrated
"You brought along that purifying potion to fix her size, because you thought she had been hexed. I had to make her bigger to not have my cover blown while continueing to have my fun." he said annoyed. Suddenly Raziel smiled. "But then, when she wanted to mess with you i had an idea". He said.
"To make us gigantic and evil" Clared asked angryli.
"Its not my fault the power got to your heads, besides you weren't supposed to steal from her anyways" Raziel said.
"What do you mean? Steal what? Did you put something in those vials" Clared asked. Raziel nodded. "Well, what?" She asked
"Potential" he said in a deep tone.
"Im not sure im following you" Clare said, confused
"Potential for growth. Its a magical thing that alters the natural outcome of things, in this case in a direction to make your friend bigger. She so wanted it, and she seemed so playful, so i decided to give her some through the vial". Raziel explained
"Then why did i get bigger?" Clare asked. A thoughtful and intelligent expression appeared on Raziels face
"You must understand that "potential" is a very complex thing. Once i "put it into something" i cant really control how it flows. For some reason you got some of it, and managed to use it faster than her, but nonetheless, she won, and i took it away so that she only remained with it" He said.
"If that was your master plan or something like that all along, then what was the point of showing up here and telling me all of this now!?!" Clare yelled at him, as she stood up.
"I got bored with your friend" Raziel said ignorantly. Depressed, Nel fell down on her bottom again. For a god he sure was hopelessly childish. As they sat at the bonfires heath, the wind howled around them. A thought came to Clares mind:
"Just how much.... "Potential" does Nel have?" She asked. Raziel counted abit on his fingers a little before his answear came:
"Well you used like.... 5% of what i put in there, sooo.... alot i guess" He said passively. Clare felt a shiver run down her spine. Raziel suddenly lifted himself into the air.
"Im bored again. Ill be jumping back to the realm of gods. Have fun kiddo" he said, as he disappeard in a warp of orange light.

Clare, still shocked, took a look into the wild Nel had trampled down before she left. Nel was already colossal, and if Raziel was right, she still had something off 70-80% left of that "growth potential" left. What if she got even bigger? WAY bigger?!?!?!
Clare looked into the horizon and noticed the lights of a large city. Someone had to know, she mustered strength in a rage of adrenelin, and lifted her wings, starting to fly towards the light.

As she got taller and bigger more of the land came into her view. She could proberbly see Clare from there. Then again, Clare was less than a speck for the growing pixie. The rubbery sound that followed the growth could be heard, even from the few miles that Clare was away from Nel. Clare didn't know how to react, besides passively floaring further and further from her growing friend. Suddenly Nels spurt stopped. The city that before had hidden Nel from Clares view, now seemed like a model city, and Nel its creator (even though she was more of its destroyer).
Clare realized she proberbly needed to try to run. Soon Nel would move, and it wouldn't be fun being anywhere near the length her legs could walk now when she did.
"Perhaps the other side of the world is nice at this time of year" Clare said to herself, as she flew away from her former destination, with all the might her wings could carry....

1152121211212112221111211122222111211.content:
If there was one thing Nel was now, it was pleased. She was not small hours ago, she was not small minutes ago, and now she was beyond not small. She was beyond gigantic. Regardless of what would happen to her from now on, she was a living change for the world. Before she was big, but now, nothing could ignore her presence in the world. She could measure herself in feet before, but now, miles proberbly would do. How tall was she, 2 or maybe 3 miles? The city around her seemed like a toy city to her. It gave her a great sense of joy looking down at the peak of human civilisation, as if it was build by insects.

Nel took a deep breath. She then took a look on the land below her. She could view more than ever. She lifted her leg, and took her first step into her new existence. As her feet landed, large cracks formed around her foot. The very world below her trembled under her empowered form. She smiled and began walking foward, not knowing what her next goal would be, but was sure it would do her good...

choices: The mage attempts to shrink them down to size with a potion
The sorceress tries a spell to solve the big pixie problem
1152121211212112221111212.content:
Nel straightened up and took a deep breath, bits of cobbled stone fell from her buttocks to the ground, her chest puffed out magnificently. As she panned her vision across the landscape, taking in this new perspective, a bird collided with her head - a bird could genuinely threaten pixies of less pronounced stature. Nel, with a start swatted at her head. She inspected her hand gingerly. "Owch." She brightened. "Wow!" she boomed "is that my voice!?" feeling it rumble out. She put a hand to her throat "Is that MY voice!?" She grinned and turned her attention back to Clare. "How'd you even see anything at this size Clare!?" She peered at the ground in mock distress, holding her bangs back from her face, "everything's so itty bitty!" She straightened up and opened her eyes wide, stretching skyward. "Guess we just have our heads in the clouds..." Clare did not look amused

"Anyway" boomed Nel, putting her hands on her hips "you need to stop being such a big ass bitch Clare!" Clare snapped to attention.
"Oh yeah?" she boomed back, Nel had twenty feet maybe on her, but she wasn't prepared to take orders.
"Well" Nel returned, drawing herself up self-righteously in attempt to appear even larger "Then I'll -!"

Kassandra's royal entourage worked its way through the throng of pixies, some watching and some running, for they had hurried to the town after reports of a "big" problem. When they reached Josh and some of the guards, the nature of the problem became clear. Pixies. Big pixies! Kassandra, after a conversation with Josh, intimated to her court sorceress and mage that they'd need to work overtime on this one. Kassandra bit her lip and looked apprehensively at the colossal pixies.

Clare lunged at Nel, unperturbed by Nel's height advantage, crashing hard into her stomach. Nel reeled but rebalanced and grappled with Clare. The gigantic pair struggled momentarily. Nel somehow managed to get the better of Clare and took the opportunity to hurl Clare onto the ground with a seismic slam. Buildings shattered to rubble as Clare's body smashed down upon them. Clare rolled quickly, squashing more under her, and grabbed Nel's leg before she had time to move. As she rose, Clare pulled Nel's leg, swinging her and sending her stumbling across the town - stamping on structures and tumbling onto her ass - shaking the ground hard with the impact of the fleshy moons. Nel stood, wincing in pain. She inspected her ass and angrily stripped the wooden picket fence that lay in a line across it. Nel buzzed her wings in rage. Then the pair clashed again - huge breasts heaving in a succession of slams; kicks and punches. Nel went down hard on her front, but caught Clare as she bore down on her and kicked her back. Nel stood, huge and sweating with exertion, she grabbed Clare and threw her forward. Clare blundered forward; tripping over the town hall's wall. She sprawled out onto of it, crushing large parts with her heaving bosom.

Nel was preparing for Clare's next assault when the shrill piping of a horn came from a nearby tree. She bent down as close as she could and attempted to focus her eyes on the tiny figures on the tree. Kassandra, shouting through the horn, yelled authoritatively at Nel. "Miss! As Queen of the pixies, I request and demand that you cease and desist in the behavior!" Nel flushed, Kassandra was pretty scary, even at Nel's size. "Don't blame me!" Nel boomed, shaking the tree "I only got this big to stop Clare! I'm just trying to help" Kassandra had began shouting again but was drowned out by Nel. Clare grabbed her from behind and the two struggled again. Clare had a good hold on Nel and was crushing the air out of her. Clare heaved Nel up from the ground and went to hurl her to the ground. Nel kicked furiously and Clare lost her footing, Nel was apparently too big to handle, and tumbled backwards pulling Nel with her. Clare would had have sprung up again, tenaious though she was, but was interrupted by Nel's tremendous butt and hips falling on her.

Clare gasped as she was squashed under her friend's weight. Nel looked apologetically at her. "Sorryyyyy!" she thundered. The voice came from the tree again "Hold on!" Nel saw many tiny pixies flitting to the scene of one giant retraining another. "We'll take it from her Miss" came a male pixie's voice. The little forms were already getting busy about Clare's pinioned Brobdingnagian body and the odd one flitted about Nel's colossal form. How tiny they look. Nel giggled, the pixies poking her here and there felt like little static charges. "Quit it!" she laughed teasingly.

Kassandra's voice came from somewhere near Nel's lofty head. "How did this happen Miss?" "How exactly did you two ladies become this large?" Nel shrugged her mountainous shoulders unhelpfully "We drank our milk?" She added evasively. Kassandra didn't get where she was by being stupid and rather than be offended by the titanic girl's lack of co-operation and risk being swatted she chose to laugh. "Hah, don't be coy my dear!" There was a brief pause. "Don't worry we'll have you two as right as rain in no time flat!" There was a gusty sigh from Clare underneath Nel. Nel too was pretty disappointed. Clare had always been big. She, Nel, had always been small. Little Nel Nightfall.
1152121211212112221111212.title: Queen Nel vs Clarezilla

choices: The potion works
Nel and Clare change their mind
11521212112121122211112121.content:
Nel told Kassandra everything she knew about her miraculous growth, leaving out no details. After all Kassandra was still her Queen. Clare listened quietly, still pinned by Nel’s enormous body. She had decided to cooperate too, but on the inside her thoughts raged. She had never felt better in her whole life. To lose this all, was a horrible thought. Her hands caressingly touched Nel’s ass. If this is hard for you, imagine how unbelievable cruel it is for Nel… She has always dreamed of being enormous and now that her dream had finally come true it is taken from her! She reminded herself. Nel, caught by surprise by Clare’s gentle touch stopped her explanations for a second. Making a small noise of pleasure – at least it was a small noise for someone of her size. Other bystanders perceived it as a loud and thundering sound.
“Set me free Nel! I’ll cooperate… I’ll promise… and I’m sorry!” Clare said. Carefully Nel shifted her weight and allowed Clare to crawl sideward. Clare set up, giving Nel her best I’m-sorry-look, slowly placing her hand on Nel’s left shoulder. Nel just nodded. She had felt the rush of growth, too. The unbelievable pleasure and power connected to it, she had not succumbed to it, because she has had an aim. Clare had been overwhelmed by the rush, acting more by instinct than by thought. Both finished the report and watched Kassandra quietly. Patiently the Pixie Queen let her both largest subjects finish their story, watching them concentrated the whole time. Finally she spoke and despite the difference and size Nel and Clare were able to hear her sultry but gentle voice clearly (perhaps the queen used magic).
“It is quite obvious that of you were affected by a chain-reaction of the effects of very potent portions, altered, emphasized and enhanced by your own magic abilities and your bodies. To counter this kind of magical reaction with a potion alone might cause unforeseeable adverse effects. So I will try to restore your former height by using diverse spells and counter-hexes and an antidote-potion.”
Kassandra strolled over the branch she was standing on, while she talked. Nel and Clare both admired the grace of her flowing movements. Kassandra was big for a pixie, the biggest known pixie until today, but she possessed almost unnatural agility and grace. While Nel and Clare had wreaked havoc upon a city and landscape while both were just trying to stand at large heights, nothing Kassandra had ever done had looked clumsy. This grace was not bought with a lean and scrawny body. On the contrary Kassandra was very well endowed. Her large bust was dominating nearly a third of her torso and was even more emphasized through her body size. A fact the queen tried to hide most of the times, by choosing very modest and stylish clothes to draw of the attention from her large bosoms. It has proven to be a futile attempt.

“But I’m afraid; I can’t do this on my own. It’ll take a powerful ritual; a lot of magic energy will be needed.” Kassandra said. Her bright green eyes seemed to glow while she was looking at Nel and Clare “I’ll need the help of the human witch Kathrin. You both know her, so don’t be afraid.” The pixie queen sounded comforting and quite. She gave both behemoth-pixies a warm smile.
“But there is another matter!” Kassandra continued. Her attitude changed, she suddenly seemed … darker. Normally Kassandra wore her very long red hair in a ponytail, but today she wore them open. The red mane gave her an almost fiery aura. “Believe me, I don’t enjoy this, but both of you have to punished for the damage and suffering you’ve caused today. Overwhelmed or not, you acted reckless and endangered many of us and the humans.”
It was incredibly but even being so much smaller then Clare and Nel Kassandra’s words were not without effect. Both giantesses lowered their head in shame, even felt a bit threatened by their queen’s angry attitude.
Kassandra’s features softened a bit: “First of all: Clean up this mess, then follow me!”
Clare and Nel nodded at each other and started to unleash their magical energy. Stones slowly hovered back, walls reappeared, cars “un-flattened” and slowly the traces of their rampage vanished. Nel felt a drop of sweat on her brow. Restoring magic was the most complicated and depletive form of pixie magic. Sparks danced around the towering, nude bodies of Clare and Nel. Nel admired Clare’s focus, the tall blonde pixie didn’t even blink while more and more sweat showed on her statuesque pale body, shimmering in the sunlight.
After five hours Nel was completely exhausted, staring blank at the repaired pixie city they were leaving behind, moving on through the large gaps in the forest. She dropped to one knee, flattening some trees beneath her gargantuan body. Angrily she spat some curses… Now she’ll have to repair this, too.
“Take a break, Nellie! I’ll handle this!” Clare said through gritted teeth. Nel wanted to complain, but with a short gesture of her left hand Clare cuts her of. Gratefully Nel sat down completely, breathing heavily, admiring her impressive busts movement while doing so. She closed her eyes and tried to regain energy. Half an hour later she heard a triumphant “Done” from Clare. Smiling she turned to her friend just to see the sweat bathed blonde pixie to tumble and hit the ground. Plowing through the newly restored forest at her full considerable length, folding trees like matches.
“Clare!” Nel shouted and dashed forward. Clare was breathing but out cold. Kassandra set down in Nel’s right ear.
“She had done well, don’t panic my dear. She is just exhausted. We need to go now!” Nel heard the queen’s voice.
“But the new damage… and Clare…” she tried to argue. “I’ll handle the new damage after the ritual. At your size it is unavoidable to destroy something, even when you’re just moving. This is why we repaired towns, humans and pixies, first. So we can proceed to the woods and thankfully Clare managed to keep it up until now. But now you’re the only one who can move Clare.” Almost mechanical Nel nodded. Gently she pulled Clare in her arms and lifted her up carefully. On her inside she hoped that no one would notice how immensely she was turned on by being able to perform such a feat of strength.
“I’ll guide you. We’ll go to the hidden valley in the south!” Kassandra said. And so the strange convoy moved. A giant Pixie, carrying an unconscious giant pixie, was followed by the pixie crown guard and moving southwards.
11521212112121122211112121.title: The mage attempts to shrink them down to size w...

choices: The potion is unstable
something diffrent happens
115212121121211222111121211.content:
The hidden valley carried the name rightfully. Large towering mountains, even taller than Nel was now, circling a large almost round valley. While the single entrance was an enormous crevice for the most beings, it had been a bottleneck for Nel, especially, with the still unconscious Clare in her arms. The valley itself was sparse, its ground was plain and craggy, with only few trees to be seen. By pixie standards it was immense, but Nel’s and Clare’s bodies at the north side nearly occupied a quarter of its total area. Kassandra had left Nel and flown to the middle of the valley where the silver haired human witch Kathrin was preparing a ritual circle with the help of some pixies. Nel rested with her back against the cold stone of a mountain. Her weight and strength had quickly reduced any disturbing ledges and irregularities. Clare, still sleeping, rested next to her, with the head on Nel’s left leg. The blonde pixies eyes were still closed, but her breath was more relaxed now. Feeling that her arms were still aching, Nel muttered “Now we are even, Clare!”. Softly she stroked Clare’s hair. Suddenly Clare’s eyelids started to flutter. And she made some soft moaning sounds
Always been tall, unlike Nel she had never dreamed about additional height. But the events of today had changed her point of view quite literally. No stranger to the joy of sexual sensations the growth has surpassed every pleasure she has known before. Her incredibly large body has proven to be sensitive beyond any measure. And now she awoke from her sleep of exhaustion she saw the most beautiful eyes she knew, the large gentle eyes of her friend Nel. The wild rage of pleasure and growth, the longing for more of this sensation had driven them into a fight without thinking. Clare smiled, admitting the truth to herself. There had never been a pixie she liked more than Nel and most likely there would never be a pixie she would love more, as friend or lover. Her hand found Nel's cheek and stroked it gently, her index finger ran playfully through Nel's long blue hair. Before both knew what was happening their lips were locked in a passionate kiss. Nel felt Clare's enormous bust pressing against her own bosom, while their tongues probed each other. Skilled Clare touched all the right spots to make Nel moan in pleasure, while she was trying to return the favor. Their enormous bodies slammed against the mountain ridge, crushing solid rock to fine powder through the impact alone. Nel came, her booming voice echoing through the valley, Clare followed swiftly. Longing for more they kept on.
The ground shook violently beneath Kassandra and her entourage. The human mage Kathrin struggled to stay upright. Their camp was on the far side of the hidden valley, but the ferocious lovemaking of the two behemoth pixies was forceful enough to make the mountains tremble on this side nonetheless. Her guards gave her nervous glares, but Kassandra just smiled gently. "Let them have their fun!", she ordered.
On the following day no one had slept at all. Nel and Clare looked exhausted but happy, the pixie guard and the human witch just tired. They prepared the ritual and the portion, with the enormous pixies sitting in the center of the valley, occasionally exchanging gentle touches and kisses. Finally Kaasandra and Kathrin gave both of them the portion and started the spell. Magic energy channeled and crackled through the air. Wild arches of mage fire glared at the mountain tops. Kassandra ordered her guards and Kathrin away from the two pixies, with a sad glare. They won't like what is happening next, she thought sad. Seconds later Nel and Clare screamed in agony. While growing had been a joyful and arousing experience, the reversal of this magic was quite the opposite. Nel clutched her head with both hands, feeling incredibly drained and sick. Next to her Clare mimicked the gesture, both titanic pixies curled up and finally passed out.
Fluttering Nel opened her eyes and almost immediately regretted it. Her stomach rebelled and she felt miserable. Everything around her had changed since her last waking moments. 'Everything is so big again', she realized. Her almost numb fingers touched something warm and soft next to her. Clare, she thought, while she helplessly patted Clare's back. Clare answered with a pained moan. Suddenly she became aware of the long and shaped female leg in front of her. 'The Queen!', she realized and started to stand up slowly and shaky. The unwilling noise from Clare told her, that Clare was doing the same. Then Nel noticed she hadn't shrunk to her old size. While Kassandra was still a head taller than Nel and Clare both pixies towered the Queens guard and with a quick glimpse at Clare's chest Nel observed that certain other improvements to their physique hadn't been completely reversed, too. Both of them still had large busts and shaped figures. But she felt too miserable to take joy from this observation.
Smiling gently, Kassandra hugged both of them. "I know you're not feeling well at the moment. But I welcome you back in the kingdom of pixies". She released them and took a step backwards. With a formal voice she declared: "You both have endangered other pixies and the human realm as well. I sentence you to work in the palace for two months, as punishment for your reckless behavior. After that you're free to return to your homes." Nel and Clare nodded weakly. Both knew this was a mild punishment. Kassandra nodded gracefully and turned to the towering human witch behind them. "I thank you for your help, Kathrin". The beautiful human smiled back at her. "It is always a pleasure, Your Grace."
Kassandra took a last look at the destroyed mountain site, marked by the love game of two titanic pixies. Then she smiled at Nel and Clare. "Follow me home!", she said.
