115212121121221.title: Find someone to help -

choices: Fine, why not...
I think I'll pass...
1152121211212211.content:
Alighting somewhat bemused on a cobbled road, Nel bit her thumb as her mind moved over her predicament. Clare's tall. Really tall; like a tree. Can't be stopped by little me, no. Could, however, be stopped by big me! But, of course, the big greedy bitch guzzled it all. Typical. Nel cast her eyes around the road distractedly. Not a human road. Too small. The round coolness of the stones beneath her soles was pleasant and soothing; she curled her toes around one meditatively. She examined a weathered, and apparently scorched, signpost across from her by a few strides. Gn....v...a...bo...! Eh? Well that was helpful. She peered at the right hand side. ...B...r....Dr... Exasperated, Nel blew air from her cheeks. Who writes these things? Selecting a path at random, she stormed down the left hand path.

Her wings were tired from evading Clare which forced Nel to frustratedly walk. After some time at this, the soothing sensation of the cobbles wore to aches and to pains. Fecking road... The condition of the road seemed too to worsen, potholes and mud were semi-ubiquitous. The surroundings too had ceded to odd swampy shrubs and wild weeds. The terrain too was notably more high and rocky. Must've walked clean out of the wood. She turned around and walked backwards briefly to look behind her. She flitted above the trees and tried to spot the forest or Clare. Nope. She then intermittently continued the journey, alternating between buzzing along and slowly walking along. Landing lightly on the road once more, Nel's foot trod in a puddle of god knows what; she withdrew her foot with a sucking sound. Her eye twitched a fraction. She picked her way to the roadside angrily. She impatiently rubbed off the muck onto the roadside grass as best she could. Fecking, Bog. Looking around, eyes narrowed, she was struck by the oddness of the place. Earthy smells permeated the air, haunted by wafts of boggy stink. Course there are plenty of places Pixies don't know. Not allowed, or just don't want to. Humans are blind though, never see anything. Hope there are no trolls.. A nearby bog made a peculiar noise. Fecking trolls. Such things were known to exist, but seldom encountered. Giants too; Dragons also. Bet Clare could give them a run for their money. No, Giants maybe, but Dragons. Huge. Huger than Clare. Nobody messes with you if you're a dragon. Apart from heroes. Stupid heroes. In stories. Of course, there's not much proof for dragons, keep to themselves more often than not. She had probably ventured in what those who were experts in this sort of thing would call: the wilds. Oh well, desperate times and all that. Nel set her jaw indignantly and flitted onwards.

Soon, from behind Nel heard clattering. She landed and cast around. What the -! Lightning quick and in a blink, a large white chicken hared round a bend in the road, clucking madly, pulling behind it a peculiar metal box on wheel. Atop the box sat a bearded little man, face blackened and raw, with a pair of goggle strapped over his head, which sported an odd little leatherlike helmet. The wagon careered wildly on two wheel as it scudded around the bend. Nel's eyes widened and she was forced to negotiated a leap from the wagon's path into a pool of slimy muck. She landed facedown; a bubble blew up to the scummy rim. Fecking Gnomes Nel's ears were reached almost instantly by a 'Whoa, Ignatius!' and more furious clucking, but the clacking of the wheels upon the road ceased. Nel lifted her head and spat. 'You okay!?' Came a high female voice. Too tired and stunned for sarcasm, Nel, blinded mud, extended a slippery arm and hand which was grasped by two sets of hands and Nel was hauled like a fish from the bog. Nel wiped the muck from her eyes with her hands and flicked them outwards; the muck slopped onto the road. 'Hold on there, miss' came the male gnome's for somewhere to Nel's right. She glared daggers at the girl who was grinning awkwardly and faintly stupidly at Nel. She was dressed like her counterpart, except beardless. She was in fact smaller than Nel, for Gnomes and Pixies were roughly the same height on average. Of course, I'm a little larger than normal. Nel noted the little curl of purple hair which protruded from under the girl's helmet. Her eyes were a little unsettling in their odd shade of pink. She's pretty...for a Gnome. Nel opened her mouth to speak and was slapped in the face by a torrent of water. A Cleaner, but wetter Nel glowered damply at the bearded gnome, who grinned proudly. 'Good as new!' he chirped in that squeaky tone of which all Gnomes seemed to be possessed. Nel continued to glare. 'Y'know what you are? You're a beard with an idiot attached... Nel shook herself, 'Cheers'. The little man beamed, 'Not often you see fairyfolk in on these roads' she commented.
'Pixie', Nel corrected.
'My apologies miss' he conceded, 'but might I ask what brings you out here?'
'Nothing really' Nel supplied evasively.
'Stop pestering her Giles!' cried the girl and booted him in the shin. He yelped and leaped away.
The girl turned, hands on her hips, and grinned at Nel, who smirked back, her mood improved.
She extended a gloved hand, 'Debby Higgs'.
Nel took the hand awkwardly, 'Nel Nightfall'. Debby titled her head towards the Giles, who was smoothing his white beard.
'That's Mr Giles Fizzlewiggin'.
'The third' pipped the old gnome.
'The third' acquiesced Debby, rolling her eyes.

Nel glanced at the chicken-drawn cart, 'So where're you two off to?' she asked intrigued by the spectacle. Debby nodded along the path, 'To the Goblin town along the road, Boomtown.' Nel raised an eyebrow. Goblin were not unlike Gnomes, not blessed with any magic, but intellectually brilliant; tempered by natural curiosity and the spirit of adventure...also outright stupidity. By common repute among magical sorts, Goblins were best avoided; not actually evil, but: callous, materialistic, vain and stupid. Gnomes were at least cute in their crazy, zany, sort of way. Goblins could do wondrous things, but usually contented themselves craftily exploiting something or other and then blowing it up, mostly to see what happened. 'I know' chipped in Debby, 'they can be real bastards, but we couldn't do it without them.' The old man was seeing to the chicken.
'And what;s that, exactly?' quizzed Nel.
'Nothing too special just -' Began Debby.
'DRAGONS!' cried the little old man from the wagon.
'Yeah, that...' Debby finished.
Nel was suitably impressed, 'Eh? What to do with Dragons?'
'Oh, all sorts really', Debby said airily, 'research on their magic properties, their flame, their variations and so on and so on.
'And why do that?' Nel pressed.
'Aha, can't go telling you that' Debby said in her almost childlike voice, 'top secret!' She tapped her nose unnecessarily.
'I really don't care that much...' returned Nel, looking down the road.
'Just tell the girl, Deborah!' shouted the old man, who appeared to have lodged himself in some sort of trunk or chest in the back of the wagon.
'Fine!' the girl shouted back. Turning back to Nel, she continued, 'Well, dragonbreath has allsorts of wicked and mad properties to begin with, but even more when you tinker with it!' The girl seemed genuinely excited by this topic. She hastily added, 'dragonblood does too! But that's not really sustainable or practical.'
'Unsustainable, yes unsustainable!' cried the old man from his box.
'Yeah exactly', rejoined Debby breathlessly, 'Can't go around killing dragons; there are so few! And...well...it's quite hard.'
'You could just wound them or something...' added Nel.
'Well, yeah that's what we did...but Dragons well...that's irrelevant', Debby broke off dismissively, ' a much better plan is to try and replicate these things from other sources.' She grinned 'We're currently working on a prototype for a dragonbreath powered engine.' She hopped in the air, 'Isn't it exciting!?'
'I genuinely don't see the point...' deflated Nel.
'Oh, well, the Goblins and the Gnomes and all their marvellous inventions and widgits are run on steam, which needs energy. Dragonbreath, because it's all magical and stuff, could run without energy.'
'Amazing' said Nel.
'I know, right!?' chirped Debby.
'No, I mean the things Goblins and Gnomes find interesting' returned Nel.
Debby continued unabated, 'Well, to be honest I think the Goblins are after money...dragons have big hordes of treasure and magical junk, you see...apart from the loads of inventions we'll be able to make and sell. Debby frowned briefly, 'But they're an alright bunch, really...just keep a grip on your purse, and if it seems like a good deal it probably isn't...'
Nel interupted Debby by straightening up and stretching, 'Well this has been weird', and she moved to flit off.
'Wait!' cheeped Debby, 'Do you want a ride, Or...?'
'Not really, no...' Quipped Nel.
Debby walked a little ahead, 'I know what you fairie- Pixies! Are like with your 'secret ways'', here she bobbled her head a little, 'But if you're after anything, it wouldn't hurt to visit Boomtown, it's full or bazaars and workshops and all sorts.
Nel glanced at the wagon, were the old man's head had become stuck in the chicken's mouth...
1152121211212211.title: On the road...

choices: Lulu
Debby
11521212112122111.content:
Looking at the eager little gnome, Nel heaved a great sigh and consented; 'Fine...whatever.' Debby positively cheeped with excitement and rushed to extricate the old gnome from the chicken's beak. Nel followed behind and adroitly fluttered into the back of the weird wagon. The old man, newly freed from the chicken, scrabbled his way up into the driver's seat again with reins in mouth. He pulled on his gloves and once again donned his goggles: with a stretching sound; a snap and a yelp. Debby hopped up beside him and looked around at Nel, grinning. Nel looked back and sat herself on a box of some sort. The cart tilted to the left; Debby cocked an eyebrow; 'Y'know, you're quite big for a pixie?' Nel, flashing a glare, ' -'Sayin' I'm fat?'
'No – no!' hastily peeped Debbie, turning around.

Despite the juddering of the wagon upon the road, Nel succeeded in dozing in the cloying, swampy, air. She was lulled to sleep by the squashing and soggy sounds that came from below her; ignoring the twittering from the girl in the front...Nel was started awake by a violent jump. She cast about blearily and wildly. It had clouded over, sudden storms were frequent in the wet highlands, a gust was blowing and the sky dripped great droplets. She heard cries from the others; the cart was violently upset. The world whirled as Nel tumbled into a roadside ditch. She, though being disoriented, made out a guttural snarl and a gout of bluish flame streaked across her field of vision. She glimpsed a snap of the little man charging forward valiantly, wrench drawn, with a cry of 'Fizzlewiggin!' Nel heard Debbie screech a 'Leg it!' Nel righted herself and scrabbled into the shrubbery. Another snarl from behind her, she, without wasting a moment, fled into the heart of the woods...

Nel, in her panic, quickly became lost in the mire. Alighting adroitly on a frond, she looked around; fog and bog everywhere. Can't see a damned thing! Arg! A fat frog sitting by he marsh edge 'bwarped'. Nel glared at the chubby amphibian, which rolled and plopped into the water. God this place reeks. A large dragonfly settled nearby. Through the murk and gloom, Nel heard a lilting sound. She followed the sound, which lead through the vines and trunks of swampy trees.

Nel continued in this fashion for some time. Just as she was preparing to give up, putting the musical chorus up to Will-o-the-wisps, she came across a glade in the impossible quagmire. In the clear stood a large willow tree, occasionally weeping leaves. Surrounding this sat a bog of considerable murk. And upon a large protruding root was sat a...Please no...The nymph ceased humming as she caught sight of Nel and waved excitedly; 'Cooeee!' Nel did not like nymphs...

This distaste was a mixture of instinctive predisposition and personal caprice. Traditionally, most magical creatures of feminine persuasion harboured an inherent distrust and resentment of the nymphs, perhaps rooted in their tendency to spirit or lure away menfolk in moments of weakness, either unconsciously or for simple fun, in floods of passion. This was always in vain, for Nymphs, though of a much pleasing form and wildly passionate, were essentially quite different in genetic makeup to most creatures such as fairies, humans or pixies. No-one knew precisely the process by which the came about, but it was known that they comprised mostly of the fundamental elements which was reflected in their choice of abode (lakes, volcanoes, clouds etc...) The elementals were rather opposed to the Gods whom it fell to to create the other creatures, suspected to be older and much steeped in mystery. Consequentially, Nymphs loved their elements more than they could ever love anything of the flesh...which didn't necessarily prohibit naughtinesses.

Nel's distate extended beyond this. Nymphs were often bodacious and excitable and this Nel found incredibly irksome, but, perhaps more so, often airily minded, or even simply stupid. Say something to them and you could hear your own voice echoing around in their head while they beamed down at you. And another thing, as if this was not enough, though Nel was small for a pixie, a pixie was rather small compared to a Nymph, who were oftenmost the size of a human child. This rendered the average Nymph, even though Nel had moderately increased in height, still three times her size. Characterised often by long flowing locks of hair to frame pale heart-shaped faces; impeccably styled tight and often revealing clothing; large dewy eyes and choir-like voices, each Nymph rounded this off, adding insult to injury, by often being buxom, bosomy and curvaceous. Nel didn't know anyone, even Clare-zilla!, who rivalled the waspish figure of the Nymphs, with their impossibly nipped in waists and look as if they were secreting ripe melons about their persons!

This bint was no exception. She sat balanced, gracefully, on a swampy root. Her thick and round thighs were crossed, squashed softly together. The Nymph coyly and effortlessly dangled a powder blue slipper from one foot; it was faintly translucent like water. Her large shapely legs were encased in a turquoise material of fishscales which glinted and shimmered in the dappled light. A short skirt of a similar fashion was tightly drawn across her rump and barely wrapped around her comely hips. The Nymph's hefty bosom pitched and bobbed what with her lively animation towards Nel, threatening to pop from from the diaphanous ribbon with affixed her ivory pumpkins tightly in place. At all times the Nymph bore a suggestion that her curves could shred out of her clothes from the strain: Nel could see the ribbon wax taught across the Nymph's chest as she hollared. The Nymph's large light eyes looked put from under the leaf of a soft bonnet-like hat, which crowned a profusion of inky blue locks, falling past her perch and hanging in the slow breeze. Her navy blue lips formed each successive cry perfectly.

Nel swore inwardly, and grudgingly acknowledged the bosomy water-sprite. The Nymph motioned Nel over to the root, with the flicking of a gloved hand. Lazy cow...But, Nel was lost and she acquiesced to the Nymph. As Nel flitted over, the Nymph idly twisted a curl of hair around a finger and waggled her feet. Nel alighted near the root, her fears were assuaged and the Nymph was indeed around three times her size. The Nymph soon chimed in with, 'Hey there cutie-pie!'
'Hello...' muttered Nel.
The Nymph giggled superfluously and grinned, 'What brings a sweetie like you all the ways out here?'
Nel shrugged, 'Got lost...'
'Oh my, you poor little thing' simpered the Nymph sympathetically.
The was an awkward silence. The Nymph looked around her for a moment, still swaying on the root. 'Well, I'm ever so thrilled you got lost!' she smiled.
Nel looked back unamused, 'I'm not...'
'You're such a cutie' trickled the Nymph.
'Yeah...thanks'
'Sorry, but I'd better find the people I was with,' Nel glanced around her, 'how'd I get out of here then?' The Nymph bit her blue lip awkwardly, 'Well...if it ain't just the darndest thing, but I genuinely have no idea.' Nel sighed audibly. 'O, now don't be like that!' the Nymph chirped, 'Why'd you ever want to leave here anyways!?' Nel moved to speak and decided against it, the Nymph continued, 'Besides, we're gonna have all sorts of fun!' she cocked her head to one side, 'it's been ever so long since I've had a friend.' Nel sat down on a patch on moss and sighed again and gazed at the murky bogwater while the Nymph watched her keenly.

The Nymph soon broke the silence,'Well so long as you're stuck here with lil ol' me....' the Nymph dripped coyly, '... what's you're name?'
'Nel' Nel replied.
'What a lovely name!' this was followed by another silence.
Giving up waiting for a prompt, the Nymph continued 'Well my name's Lulabelle...or Bella...or Lulu...I don't mind!' She grinned again widely.
Nel looked at Lulu, 'Doesn't your face ever get tired...what with all the smiling?'
'Whatchya mean silly?' Lulu beamed back.
'Nevermind' sighed Nel. Nymph's didn't really DO sarcasm, irony...and anything subtle. Lulu contented herself by rocking back and forth on her root, which creaked oddly under her weight.

Some time passed, made longer by the discussions about what's your favourite: fish, colour, type of water body, flower, bird continue ad infinitum. Nel interrupted a scintillating conversation about what Lulu like about baths with, 'What's up with this bog?'
'It's not right is it?' asked Lulu worriedly.
'Doesn't look it' Nel replied uncertainly, recoiling slightly as a large bubble of sludge ballooned from the quag.
Lulu bit her lip in distress, 'Oh! It is those awful Goblins and their horrid city!' with tears beginning to form in her eyes she cried, 'They have polluted my lovely lil bog!'
Nel quized further, in order to stop the Nymph from bawling, 'Why what have they done?'
Pointing towards a metal barrel in the midst of the polluted swamp that surrounded the misty tree, Lulu whined, 'They come on down from those hills and dump all their horrible...stuff...in my lovely swamp. Now all my friends won't come near me! All the lil' critters have run off...' Her blue lips quivered. Nel wandered for closer inspection, 'I wouldn't touch it cutie pie...It is all nasty and poisonous.' Nel did feel some sympathy for the Nymph, they genuinely felt for the habitat to which they attached themselves. Nel sat down and waited while the Nymph sobbed quietly.

From across the glade came a snarl and a roar, accompanying a terrific thundering. Both Lulu and Nel watched the gloom. Indistinctly, they saw a small furry figure streak from the woods screaming and jabbering. Soon afterwards can a blurry pink fuzz. It must be those gnomes! Which means...From the trees burst and nightmarish creature of blue and dark green, huge, long and lizard-like. A gout of blue flame erupted from its jaws. Distracted from this, Nel heard a thick splash from the bog...Who fell in!?
11521212112122111.title: Fine, why not...

choices: Lulu swallows the salamander...
Lulu flicks it away...
115212121121221111.content:
Nel's attention was quickly detracted from the bubbling swamp. The huge salamander crawled forward from the copse of trees, jaws slavering; molten blue spittle searing the moss and wet grass. Boiling steam snorted in jets from its nostrils. 'Run for it!' cried Debbie as she skittered past Nel. Thinking quickly, Nel zipped behind the willow tree. A snarl pierced the glade again. The black claws screeched against the rocks as it pursued the gnomes; Nel espied a wrench embedded in one of its huge teeth. As it stormed past its great tail collided with the tree. It splintered as if struck by lightning. It creak and cracked as it toppled slowly. Nel darted in earnest from its shadow as it slammed where she had been moments before.

Debbie's legs could only convey her so fast, her chest bounced rapidly as she sprinted. She readjusted her helmet which had slipped over her eyes. The salamander was gaining on her like a thundering storm. Its huge jaws gaped like hell, impending on the gnome girl, open to swallow. In the blink of an eye Nel tackled Debbie from its path as the cavernous maw snapped its jaws shut on thin air. The salamander thrashed in rage and rampaged into the trees, rolling frantically, having confused itself in its anger. Nel and Debbie rolled a distance off, and scrambled quickly to their feet. Debbie looked at Nel in appreciation, panting heavily; 'Thanks...' Nel averted her gaze; '...'s'nothing'.

Their little moment was interrupted but a low growl. The salamander cracked its way through the undergrowth once more; another gout if fire was belched into the sky. Nel made to dart away from the raging dragon once more, but fell immediately. She scrabbled around and looked back frantically, her chest heaving her eyes identified the problem. Her leg was ensnared by a twisted root. She tugged, but it was wedged in tight. Debbie rose the the occasion and clutched Nel's knee and pulled as well. Nel winced and strained, this wouldn't have happened when she was just a fraction smaller. 'Come on, come on!' muttered Debbie through gritted teeth. Nel felt a hot wind on her back and in her hair. Nel did not need to bother turning around, she could even see the immense white jaws reflected in the gnome's wide eyes. Nel sighed inwardly, why did things like this insist on happening?...Out of the Giant Clare frying pan and into the Swamp Dragon fire...

Nel tried one last time to force the tree to relinquish her, but to no avail. She sighed again. This wouldn't be a problem if she was bigger; as big as Clare or bigger! She could pick up that little lizard by the tail, between finger and thumb, dangling and then flick him across the forest. If she was huge, then we'd see who pushed who around. Nel sighed again. 'I'd advise you run away now' she breathed to Debbie, who was transfixed with fear.
'N-n-no...' she peeped. Nel raised an eyebrow.

The pair prepared themselves, though Nel could not turn to see, as the Dragon crawled its way towards them, bearing down on them with molten spittle dripping from its jaws. The jaws gapped, the stench of ground-gas and bog water leaked from them. Nel closed her eyes... but nothing. The dragon had frozen and was casting around quizzically.

The ground trembled faintly and a rumbled. Debbie watched through her fingers as a pebble bounced a little and vibrated. Debbie, uncovering her face, looked around confused as well. The trembling became more severe, a groaning echoed through the ground. The bog water a while off churned and bubbled. The dragon sniffed the air tentatively, then snorted steam. The dragon turned its attention back to the gnome, advancing threatening. The swamp heaved, with an immense sucking and squelching. Nel was conscious of a shadow spreading across her. 'What's happening?' she cried blindly. The gnome's jaw dropped, dumbfounded. Nel twisted to try and see, but couldn't. Nel watched as the shadow stretched across the glade.

Meanwhile, Debbie watched a rather different show. From the sludge ascended a black willow tree of hair, running with slime. This was followed by a long, sharp ridge of a nose, sludge dripped from its elegant point. Debbie could not believe what she was experiencing as two huge hills of breast flesh rose from the swamp, ploughing into and upturning the soft banks as they increased in girth, before rising skywards. Bog water ran in sheets from the bosomy knolls. Increasingly a burbling, rubbery sound was making itself known, as if a water balloon were slowly swelling and swelling, becoming fatter and swollen. It bubbled and gurgled, became louder and louder like the squelching of a hot water bottle. Debbie stepped slowly backwards as the figure became taller and taller, the shadow stretched and occluded the length of the clearing with darkness The dragon, apparently convinced of its own fearsome aura, remained oblivious – they could be surprisingly dim witted some times. Debbie's head inclined more and more, craning her neck to take stock of the bog colossus, which was continuing to become bigger and bigger. Past the jaws of the dragon, Debbie could see a pair of whale-like hips emerging from the murk, their volume flaring with a thick flesh gurgle to gigantic proportions. The dark wet figure loomed immense now, growing so swiftly that those hips where followed by bulging round thighs of such thickness, Debbie wondered as she watched them transpire from the waters and round out with a fat murmuring. Debbie gawked as tremendous hips expanded like a flesh canopy. The woman now almost eclipsed the sky with her stature. She stood knee deep in the swamp, but towered over the clearing.

The dragon froze as from above thundered; 'OH MERCY!' Lulu's voice shook the ground with volume. The dragon rounded, and cowered in the shadow of the thundering nymph. 'Oh no...'not again thought Nel, still unable to appreciate the size to which the Nymph had ballooned. 'LOOKS LIKE 'A'VE PUT ON A LITTLE WEIGHT!' boomed Lulu as she inspected herself. The dragon cowered like a frightened dog. 'MERCY! AH REALLY AM EVER SO BIG!' She bit her lip anxiously, eyes downcast to the scene below. The Nymph's huge violet eyes caught the sight to the dragon. Her brow knitted. She put her hands on her hips and pouted. 'THINK YOU CAN PUSH LIL' GIRLS AROUND, HUH? Before the dragon could escape, she had pinched its tail between her huge, long, white thumb and finger. Debbie marvelled at the sheen of those immense blue fingernails. The salamander was lifted to the cloudy heights of Lulu's head. The dragon, the size of a large crocodile to a human, dangled and thrashed desperately in the Lulu's colossal grip. 'WELL,' she inspected herself again. 'AH'VE BEEN DOING A LITTLE GROWIN'' she placed her free hand on her hip, and projected her huge bosom. 'AAAAND IT LOOKS LAHKE I AIN'T SO LITTLE ANYMORE!' she thundered in her silky, melody-like, voice. She bit her lip coyly and flashed her lilac eyes towards the specks of Nel and Debbie...
115212121121221111.title: Luviathan

choices: Surprise, surprise, Lulu grows even bigger!
Lulu is still thirsty and wanders off into the woods, leaving them behind!
Lulu is all hot and bothered, she needs another sort of satisfaction, now!
1152121211212211111.content:
Nel and Debby craned their necks and cast their eyes upwards from the sucking mire and splintered wood at the huge and dripping nymph, outlined against gathering clouds, and the salamander lashing as it dangled from her fingers. Only minutes before, the salamander has seemed huge in comparison to the pixies and nymph in the clearing, but now it hung from looming nymph’s hands like long, blue licorice or a chili pepper. In spite of her dislike for nymphs, and her reservations about having another giant girl running amok, for the nymph must be northwards of thirty, even fifty, foot tall, and not a jot less bodacious at that, Nel could not help heaving a sigh of relief at being snatched from danger, or, rather, having danger snatched from her way. Nel could not actually see the nymph’s face any longer, obscured as it was by a heaving bosom, but Debby, from atop the toppled tree, could see the sharp features of Lulu’s heart-shaped regarding the salamander with some unease, biting her plump, blue bottom lip. The raging lizard let out a gout of fire as it thrashed, causing Lulu to lurch backwards, holding the salamander at arm’s length. The others on the ground could see the huge nymph casting about for somewhere to dispose of the salamander, as if for a waste-paper basket or other receptacle. Obviously, she found none. She could not dispose of the lizard in the nearby vicinity; it would only go after those little gnomes and pixie. Lulu seemed to stand for some time, pondering, a slight frown on her brow; Nel, as she was pulled free by Debby, could not help but enjoy a laugh to herself at the concentration the nymph apparently required.

But as the giant nymph pondered, there brewed a sound like thunder in the glade, a gurgling sound, which came not from the clouds about, but from the nymph’s gut. A look of embarrassment crossed Lulu’s blu-tinged cheeks as she clapped her free hand to her belly, “‘Scuse me!”, she boomed, “but I really am evah so famished!” Just then, the nymph’s face suddenly brightened. “I know!” Lulu chirped, seeming to straighten up. Nel and Debby exchanged confused glances. Planting her feet beside one another, Lulu dangled the furious salamander aloft, now thrashing above her head. As Nel and the little gnome watched, Lulu swept back her green-blue hair, and casually let her mouth fall open. Nel’s mouth too opened, but hers in incredulity. The salamander, too, stopped its thrashing in shock and horror at the abyss opening below it. But this, as it happened, turned out to be a grave mistake, for the moment the salamander ceased its flailing was when Lulu, as a nymph ever a slave to her body, took her chance with lightning quickness. Nel was conscious of a flurry of activity and half-imagined Lulu’s huge and plump blue lips slurping a long tail down wetly like spaghetti, she thought she heard Lulu’s teeth snap shut, but what both Nel and Debby definitely heard was a loud and unctuous gulp. Only a slight moment passed before the swampy clearing was shaken by a satisfied and thunderous belch. “Phew! ‘Scuse me!” Lulu boomed. As she said so, Lulu burped again; furrowing her brow in a look of concern and thumping her chest, “Oohh”, she breathed, as another belch passed from her in mid-thought, “spicy…” Lulu seemed almost to swallow the last word, fanning one huge hand, while, Nel imagined, though could not discern, her eyes were watering.

The danger now...gone, Nel approached, in frank disbelief. Debby already stood not far from the towering nymph on a grassy mound on the marshy ground. Nel mounted the mound and regarded the huge nymph, who, after the scene with the salamander was casting around the clearing for the grumpy, little pixie and adorable little gnomes. Nel put her finger in her mouth and whistled sharply. Hearing this, Lulu turned to look down at them, peering down at them, her hands on her knees, so her huge and blubbery breasts hung pendulously, like huge teardrops buoying up and down gently. “Well hello again!” beamed Lulu “you are even more adorably itty bitty now!” Nel momentarily lost her train of thought, transfixed by something which she was convinced was a glinting shoal of tiny fish flitting across the bluish and faintly translucent globe of Lulu’s right breast. For just a moment, Nel could not help but take in the fine network of faint, purplish veins unfolding in a lattice beneath the surface of those enormous boobs. Regaining herself, Nel resumed her air of haughty impatience with the nymph. “What was that!?”, said Nel, “Why did you even d⸻” “Sorry darling?” boomed Lulu, interrupting, “I can’t hear little you.” Lulu crouched down the better to hear Nel and the gnomes, her chin resting childishly on her hands as they were piled atop her knees, in great ignorance of how much she infuriated Nel. Nel cupped her hands and shouted now, “What the hell were you thinking!?” Lulu flushed again and boomed back “I’m sorry darlings! I was just ever so famished.” Nel shouted back “So!? That was so bloody stupid of you! Why in the world didn’t you just toss that thing!?” Lulu furrowed her brow again but did not respond this time. “Oi!” Nel yelled, “frogspawn-for-brains, I said⸻” Nel found herself drowned out by the thunderous groaning of Lulu’s stomach once more, of a tenor so violent and loud that it sounded like a furnace full of molten slag in the nymph’s belly. As Nel went to continue, the rumbling could be heard to travel upwards, and as it did so the nymph’s eyes widened and she straightened up, perched squatting on her haunches, before erupting as another therous belch. Nel, though interrupted, could not help but be thankful that the nymph had the good grace not to burp in their faces.

Nel opened her mouth to speak again but Lulu, finished thumping her chest, suddenly let herself keel backwards, her monstrous buttocks slamming into the soft ground with a squelch deafening to Nel and Debby. Indeed, such was the suddenness of the nymph’s impact that Debby fell herself and Nel almost pitched forward into the mud. “Hey!” screamed Nel “Watch it!” “Oops!” boomed Lulu putting her hand to her lips, “sorry littlies! Ahm just not so used to being just this big an’ bouncy!” “And”, went on the giant nymph, “ahm not sure that little ol’ lizard⸻Uurrrp,” her Lulu belched once more, “⸻agreed with little, big me!” Debby clambered to her feet as Lulu said this, turning to see the nymph sitting in the clearing, legs splayed immodestly, seeming to yawn at Nel and herself as if they might devour them both. Debby casually averted her eyes, which Nel continued to fume. “It serves you right” yelled Nel, matter of factly. “The better question is what’re we to do with you!”

Lulu appeared to ponder the question. “Well,” she eventually boomed, “I usually dry out in a couple a days.” Nel was incredulous, “So this happens often!?”, she shouted back. Lulu waggled her head, “Sometahmes...nevuh this big though!” she added with some degree of pride cut with embarrassment as she drew herself up in her sitting position and indicated her huge and voluptuous body. “Well,” shouted Nel, ignoring Lulu’s bosomy might, you’ll never dry out in this weather, it looks like rain.” Lulu grinned, “Yup!”, she boomed childishly, “when it starts pourin’ I just start a swellin’ an’ swellin’!” Nel ignored this too and asked Debby how far to the nearest town. Debby replied that it was still an hour away, and while they could probably find shelter for Lulu, they no longer had their wagon. “Well,” said Nel, “big and bouncy there might just come in useful then; she could walk that easily.” “Indeed” chimed Debby, nodding happily.

Nel fluttered up to the huge nymph. “Right, come on, we know where to go, we’ll hitch a ride on you” said Nel. But although the nymph’s mercurial eyes converged on Nel hovering before her nose, Lulu seemed not to have heard her. Nel repeated herself, but to the same response. Again Nel made clear her plan and while the nymph’s features changed to one of discomfort, Lulu still did not reply. Instead, she groaned and clutched her stomach again. Nel fluttered backwards in case the clumsy nymph might accidentally swat her. Indeed, Nel could hear quite distinctly the groaning not just of the nymph but of her stomach. Steam was about to come out of Nel’s ears with anger when she noticed steam actually rising softly from the nymph’s shoulders and, glancing down that great drops of perspiration were forming on the expanse of breast-flesh below her; it was as if Lulu were boiling up! As if to confirm her suspicions, the giant nymph began to pant and breathe heavily, her long, blue tongue lolling, fanning herself with a huge hand. As this continued, buckets of sweat started to leap from the nymph’s body. Nel began to harbour some hopes that the giant nymph would eventually be shrunk by this sweating and wondered for a moment, darkly, if the salamander might burst from her plushy belly once she did.

Nel’s hopes were short lived. Almost as suddenly as she’d swallowed the salamander, the panting and steaming Lulu whipped around, the monstrous bulk of her ass almost fatally clouting Nel as it swivelled and was thrust skywards. Before Nel realised and could stop her, too busy avoiding giant buttocks, Lulu had plunged her mouth and chin to the bog from which she had not long emerged. Clouds of steam gushed from Lulu as she did so, cooling herself with gulp after gulp of marshy water. Nel was at a lost flew through the steam and screamed in Lulu’s ear, “What’re you doing you bubble-brained idiot!? How’s this going to make you and smaller!?” Nel grabbed hold of Lulu’s ear and tugged, “You’re. just. getting. BIGGER!” yelled Nel with frustration. Her thirst seemingly slake, her body cooled, Lulu withdrew from the bog and sat once more on the marshy ground, Nel still dangling from her ear. Lulu drew a hand across her mouth and gasped a sigh of relief, followed soon afterwards by a rich and thunderous belch: “UUUURRP!”
1152121211212211111.title: One hot tamale!

choices: Ah think ahm growin' again!
Ah am awful hungry all of a sudden
1152121211212211112.content:
A grin which seemed like a crescent moon split the milky skin of the nymph's face, the navyblue of her lips stretching taut and thin from their plumpness, her teeth, which became increasingly revealed as the grin grew wider, glowed in the shade of her mouth with a yellowish aura like bannanaflesh, their wet and cloying sheen dully shining in the recesses of her colossal mouth, rows of pale, dim, candles. Her smile, thus waxing across her tallowy complexion, which also glowed but with its own sort of anemic light, met with the limits of lateral expression and curled at the corners in a graceful arc, cresting the stretching of her lips with roundings of navyblue, slicing so slightly more into the thick cream of her cheeks. Her teeth glowed like a darkly light church-hall in the seemingly cavernous, blue fringed, aperture and her skin glowed like the waxiness of a candle and so too did her eyes glimmer and crackle with a dusky phosphorescence of violet and yellow, which in their spots of greater clarity and brilliance in the murky blue pools recalled the finesse of stained glass - seeming to glow now as one, many dull wicks lit and entombed in the recesses of an immense ivory Jack-o-lantern . Glowing, these eyes languished on the slim form, though once huge and hulking to her point of view, hung from her hand, become substantially larger. The nymph’s eyes rested lazily on the writhing reptile suspended from its tail in front of her face, pinched between the sizable and long candles of her index finger and thumb - the cause of her amusement and the cause of her smile, rooted, ultimately, in the impish glee, derived from deep in her watery soul, in experiencing the balance of physical size between herself and the salamander being redrawn in her favour and the wealth of coy possibilities of which she could use this adjustment to avail herself. Blinking softly, the blue candlelight irises flicker and gutter briefly.

The thrashing lizard snorts a slim spark of flame into the air from piping nostrils, flanged with horny skin, the texture of which the massive nymph’s eyes finds difficulty in picking out,, the jet quickly dissipates in a lingering haze of bluish smoke, reeking of brimstone, which is soon snorted from the atmosphere by the immense sucking of the nymph’s breathings. Wrinkling her nose she snorts, wettly, back outwards which extinguishes another jet of flames in its initial stages of delivery, and shocked the blue lizard dangled limply from her big, thick, waxy fingers, charged with fire like a feisty blue chili. Seized by the moment and the notion, the nymph lofts the dragon’s weight with ease higher to hang above her head, running her long tongue along her plump blue lips it separates them stickily from one another and follows this by parting the walls of her teeth and gaping wide her mouth, in the dark cavity lurks her red tongue, retreated there from her lips to rest there, dark and wet - the trashing thus resumed this time bestowed the kind of vigor peculiar to those who are faced with the imminent prospect of being swallowed. A change of heart swells in the nymph and she claps shut her mouth, lowering the lizard - though still thrashing the continual efforts towards any escape, or attempts to influence the nymph, exerted, and their lack of effect on the nymph, act as a testament to its comparative feebleness and the immense strength and power the massive increase in size has afforded the water nymph - the nymph giggle girlishly in booming peals, with her free hand twisting an incredible locks of dark blue hair, like the coiling fronds of the tree of the night sky, around her long tapering hand.

Gently, the nymph flexes and slightly swings the dangling dragon like a pendulum, appearing to meditate on something, holding her mouth in a delicate purse of blue and to one side of her waxwork white face; she languidly rolls her large tongue around the inside of the cave her mouth. Too hot to handle, a thought gently sparks into the clouds of her mind, again a smile spreads across her face like the splitting of warm wax.


Viewing from below, level with the bog that roots the nymph’s thick ankles, past a thick, waxy, trunk of white thigh and the immensity of a bulwark of hip, semi-obstructed by a projection of breastflesh, Nel and the gnomes watch as the dragon, which seemed huge to them, was gently revolved and then rotated and soon spun, building steadily to a twirl, by the strong turning of the nymph’s thick wrist. Biting her tongue, the nymph lofted the whirling lizard and let it fly away, spiraling, across the treetops. The nymph mockingly covered her brow and shielded her eyes attempting to see the speeding lizard and giggled: she extended one huge and long arm and waved: ‘BUH-BYE!’ and boomed again with laughter... Nel and the gnomes exchanged glances and looked back up at the huge nymph, who looked mirthfully down at them, but this expression soon clouded and she boomed- 'GAHYS...'
1152121211212211112.title: It's all in the wrist

choices: Nel has an idea and takes a dunk in the bog
They set off into the woods
11521212112122111121.content:
The sky was starting to drip and the drops of rain where dotting and splashing hither and thither. Nel looked up at the nymph’s face, becoming increasingly indistinct through the falling drizzle; her colossal form vaguely silhouetted and obscured darkly against the gray of the sky; a long indigo tress adhered to her jaw, dark wirework inlaid into enamel: the nymph cupped her hands over her heaving, wet breasts, the thick flesh bulging perceptibly in leeway between each finger. To hold back her bust was like holding thick cream, Nel mused, she might been bigger than Clare!

- ‘AH THINK AHM -the overgrown nymph balked as her body creaked and groaned like the stretching of rubber - WAHHHH!’ The huge nymph blubbered and burst, huge tears leaping from her face into the rain. Lulu hefted her huge, thick leg from the sucking quag and brought it down onto the damp ground, a few feet from Nel and the gnomes, with a rumble: from around her hulking foot bubbled and oozed the water from the pulpy bog ground; soon after followed the other tree trunk leg, touching down just beside the onlookers, who reeled backwards to avoid the colossal, clumsy nymph - Nel could faintly distinguish the wet flesh of the huge calve swell thicker even as it lifted into the air.

As the plashing of rain intensified, Lulu boomed through the trees, retreating with dull, thunderous footsteps. Nel and the gnomes picked themselves up from the wet earth, where they had been knocked by the shuddering of the giant nymph’s stomping as she bawled into the trees: they could hear her resounding tread already far off in the woods, muted by the sound of the rain. Nel, dodging the occasional raindrop, flitted over to the treeline, followed by the gnomes shortly afterwards, who came scampering along behind. Nel rubbed her eyes with the heels of her hands, sighing in exasperation as a cloud of birds flew into the air some way off; why is everyone insisting on growing? not like any of them needed it!

Nel looked pensively at the outline cleaved through the grove by the mountainous nymph, thundering by like a blossoming glacier: the waxing arc of her hips sundering the trunks of trees in her path; her broadening shoulders snapping and pushing aside boughs which obstructed the way; her strengthening arms and lengthening hands sweeping aside and baling fronds and branches from her face and body. Splintered wood, bleeding sap into the wet rain, lay along the corridor formed in the nymph’s wake. Nel noted the way in which the corridor seemed to widen as it got further away from where she stood: the cleft of the hips in the trees spread laterally, clipping and knocking more and more trees and, simultaneously, rose higher and higher up the trunks with each impact. Nel’s eye picked out that, some ways down the forest corridor, the nymph’s head had broken through the canopy above; the pale light fell down from this rupture down onto the path below from that point on; widening further as her broadening shoulders had mounted to the point where they, and her pitching chest, carved through the canopy and Nel thought she could distinguish, through the haze of the rain, that further on the nymph’s shoulders and breasts were replaced by her thunderous hips in her foray through the woods. Nel placed the heels of her hands over her eyes again: God she’s gonna be huge...

Debbie shuffled from foot to foot: ‘What now?’
11521212112122111121.title: Through the woods

choices: Nel heads back to the others and comes up with a new plan
Nel continues to pursue Lulu
115212121121221111212.content:
Nel sighed. She didn't want to be a part of this. Sure, earlier today the prospect of becoming larger weighed on her mind, but now she wanted everything to be over. She was tired. And cold. And hungry. As annoying as it was that everyone around her seemed to be turning into giants, she just wanted to go home and sleep for a day or two. She looked back at the gnomes that were her forced companions. Nel thought that they were kind of annoying, and kind of a hassle, BUT Debbie had saved her life today, so Nel felt some sort of obligation to help her out if possible. She also had the giant Clare on the back her mind, and a growing nymph on the loose. Nel figured that maybe if she chased after the nymph and got her to calm down, Lulu might be able to help her with her Clare problem.

"Alright," she started, turning back to her gnomish companions, "I'm going to go after that nymph. Can't very well have her causing a ruckus for innocent folks." Nel actually didn't care too much about the nymph causing trouble, but she DID care about people getting hurt, and it seemed likely with the state and size of the oversized fey creature. "You two stay here, hopefully I won't be long." Lifting off, Nel flew above the forest, following the path of destruction left by the enormous girl. It wasn't easy, since it had started raining, and visibility was low. Nel could have sworn that it looked like the trees were shaking though. Just how big had Lulu gotten now? Nel couldn't see her, even though she had to easily clear the tops of the forest trees.

What Nel hoped would be a short flight proved to be much longer as minutes stretched into an hour, then two hours. Nel saw the path of destruction steadily increase in size until it separated into 2 lines of mowed down trees, then resolved into a set of fantastically sized footprints that steadily grew larger. Nel gulped. By now one footprint was longer than Lulu had been tall last time she saw Lulu, and still she hadn't caught sight of her. It was getting dark, and Nel still hadn't found Lulu. Nel considered giving up and returning back to the others. On the other hand, she had been flying for quite some time. The nymph couldn't be THAT much farther... right? Nel contemplated this as she briefly stopped for a rest in a stretch of forest stamped flat by the colossal Lulu, the print easily large enough that a human village could have fit in it...
115212121121221111212.title: They set off into the woods

choices: Nel flies up to Lulu's eye, hoping that she would be seen
Nel flies up to Lulu's ear, hoping that she could be heard
1152121211212211112122.content:
Nel stretched her wings out and took a sip from a nearby pool of rainwater. If she turned around now, she'd just have to come back this way again later. Assuming she could get Lulu to agree to help her, the trip back wouldn't take anywhere near as long. Nel took off again. The rain had stopped by now so she was making much better time, but the footprints were getting farther and farther apart. Fairly soon, though, Nel started to hear a sound. It quickly became louder - much, much louder - and became more distinct. It was like someone sobbing, except in such a loud and low bass tone that it didn't sound like any creature Nel had heard before. Nel kept following it, assuming that it was Lulu she was hearing. Even being able to hear her, Nel couldn't see Lulu at all. As Nel flew nearer and nearer, she felt the air stirring and pulsing back against her. It was as if... no, it had to be. Lulu was so big that her great sobs were causing shockwaves in the air that pushed against the fairy. Shortly, they became powerful enough that Nel couldn't make headway against them. Just as she was about to give up and land, a sudden gust of wind blasted her towards the sound. Screaming, Nel tumbled through the air as the wind carried her at incredible speeds.

In no time, the titanic Lulu came into view. Despite herself situation, Nel was dumbfounded by what she saw. Lulu had grown from a figurative mountain into a literal one, or even a literal mountain range. A momument of firm yet plump womanly flesh, Lulu was a behemoth beyond comprehension now. A single eye could have filled a human's view horizon to horizon if they were close enough to it, let alone a tiny fairy like Nel; a strand of hair could have encircled a large human city, perhaps more than once, and would have been thicker than a car; her ears were big enough that a large aircraft would have been able to safely land, turn around, and take off again in them, with plenty of room to spare; her mouth could have sucked down an entire fleet of ships into a whirlpool bigger than any before, if she were able to find a body of water that was deeper than the back of her head to her lips; her nose could have snorted up an entire city in one inhale, or with one exhale flattened said city and sent every building and person in it flying away on the billowing wind created by her mighty lungs. Nel was particularly fixated on this last bit, because she was being rapidly sucked up into said nostrils. Nel reflected that whenever she thought a day couldn't get any worse, it somehow did.

Luckily for her though, before she could disappear forever into the cavernous nose of her giant quarry, Lulu stopped inhaling. Nel, still tumbling head-over-heals in the air, crashed into something firm yet soft and pleasant-smelling. After her head stopped spinning, Nel looked around and discovered she had crashed into the cheek of this gargantuan girl. Looking up, she saw the curve of Lulu's cheek lead into a massive eye that was currently closed, a river of tears steaming down from both sides and waterfalling down either side of her eye. Below, Nel could see Lulu's nose to the left, and her plump, full lips parted while her bawling cries echoed over the land. Nel realized that even though Lulu's face seemed to stretch up and down forever, she was actually lying down and all the great distance below Nel was just from where she rested on Lulu's cheek to the bottom of her chin. 122211222.content:
Well this wasn't good. This wasn't good at all! Nel was less than a bug to Kevin now. Her magic wasn't very strong in most circumstances, but now, she would be powerless against something as big as Kevin. Conversely, Kevin's own magic power was now increased several times over. It wouldn't take long for word of this to spread throughout the land and reach Pixie City where Kassandra, the current Pixie Queen, would hear about it. Technically, she wouldn't even be considered the Queen anymore, as her powers would be nothing compared to Kevin's. And worst of all, the fruit was gone. All of it. That bag hadn't had much to begin with and there was a chance that fruit was one of a kind. No, the only thing she could think of doing was heading back to her village to talk to Josh, the leader of her village, and have him send word to Pixie City so Kassandra could try and sort all this out. She took one last look at Kevin, heading towards the nearest human settlement, and just stared. Despite the fact that he had swatted her away like a bug, she still had feelings for him. In his growth he had shredded away his clothes. Kevin hadn't been wearing much to begin with, just a small pair of shorts, a half vest, and some leaves wrapped around half of his foot for shoes. The other Pixies often wondered at this strange dress, but since it showed off a lot of his athletic body, Nel never cared. And now he was completely nude! Nel could see Kevin's manhood, bigger than her several times over! She shook her head to clear it of these impure thoughts and turned and flew back towards her village.

It didn't take long to make it back and Nel instantly headed straight toward the biggest building in the village where Josh would be found. The building was big by Pixie standard but any human who found it would be sure to think of it as nothing more than a child's playhouse. Surrounding it was a gate and guarding the gate were two male Pixies one 1'8'' tall and the other 1'7'' tall. Both towered over Nel, but she wasn't about to be intimidated. She marched right up to them (being unable to fly over the gate since the area around this government building was a strict no fly zone enforced by a powerful spell set by Kassandra herself. She often traveled to the other villages renewing those old spells that had been set long ago when the villages were first built. Every Pixie ruler was charged with this duty in addition to their other responsibilities.) and said, "I need to speak with Josh! It's an emergency!"

The guard on the left, who had red hair, said, "Absurd! Josh it currently dealing with a momentous problem facing the Pixie village. Surely whatever a runt like you has to say would pale in comparison to his duties?"

Nel stomped her foot and said, "Stick a cork in it Azriel! I'm in no mood! I'm not a child anymore and I won't be bullied by you!"

The other guard, who had longer blonde hair, laughed and said, "You're as feisty as ever Nel! However, Azriel is right. Josh is currently dealing with the recent drought conditions. Surely you know how important that is? If this drought continues any longer, we won't be able to grow any food."

Nel sighed and said, "That's a small problem compared to what I have to say! Just let me in for five minutes! That's it! Please Azriel? Please Rok?"

The two guards looked at each other and Azriel shrugged and said, "You decide."

Since Rok was slightly taller, he held slight authority over Azriel. Rok looked at Nel's desperate face and relented. "You may enter. But only for five minutes. I've known you since you were a little girl Nel and I know how tricky you can be. Don't waste Josh's time with idle stories."

Nel, all smiles now, said, "Don't worry I won't! Thank you both!"

The gates opened and Nel rushed inside, pushed open the double doors leading into the government building and ran inside. Everyone that worked within were all much taller than Nel who slipped in unseen. She quickly made her way down a hallway towards a door marked: Josh-Leader. She pushed open the heavy door and ran inside. Josh was looking over some papers and only glanced up when the door opened. Since Nel was so small, she couldn't be seen over the paperwork on his desk so he didn't know immediatley what was going on. He stood up and spotted Nel, bending down to talk to her.

"What is it Nel?" he asked kindly.

Nel quickly told her story about the human on horseback, the mysterious bag containing a strange fruit, about giving the fruit to her friend to test it's edibility. Josh didn't comment, but his look of surprise quickly changed to concern as Nel explained about how Kevin had eaten one and grown taller and then eaten the rest of the fruit and grown even bigger, bigger than any Pixie, bigger than any human! Josh couldn't believe what he was hearing.

"I thought I had felt the ground shake earlier." Josh muttered to himself. "Yes, Kevin lives far away. We wouldn't have noticed this drastic change..."

"What are we going to do?" Nel asked, worried about her friend.

"This kind of problem is out of my hands. We're going to have to see Kassandra about this. Nel I'm charging you with a very important task. Do you know where Pixie City is?"

"Of course!" Nel said, offended that Josh would think she didn't. "What Pixie doesn't know the way to Pixie City?"

Josh smiled and said, "Very well. I'm going to write a letter to Kassandra. I want you to take it to Pixie City and deliver it to her personally. No one should give you any trouble since I'm sealing the letter with the insignia of our village. If anyone gives you trouble, show them this letter and you should be okay. No Pixie would dare hurt a messenger."

"And what if I meet someone who isn't a Pixie?" Nel asked, nervous in spite of herself.

"Then you will have to do what you can to escape. Use the magic you've learned in your studies to conceal yourself, to move fast through unfriendly territory, to be without danger."

Nel nodded, thinking of her pocket book of spells in her room. It would be a good idea to bring a reference with her. She flew up to look over the paperwork and watched Josh write out the letter to Kassandra. Nel looked at the size of the letter and started thinking about how she was going to carry it. But it was an unfounded worry. As soon as Josh sealed the letter with a blob of wax and pressed the insignia of the village into the warm red wax, he tucked the letter into a small bag. Nel instantly recognized it as a magic satchel, a treasure created by powerful magic. The bag was small enough for her to carry in both hands, but she knew it could hold an unlimited amount of anything. All she had to do was stuff it into the bag, even if it was several times the bag's size. To pull it back out, she recited to herself, all I have to do is think about what object I want and it will appear in my hands.

Josh bent back down and said, "Good luck Nel. Make sure that letter reaches Kassandra no matter what. Do not take any detours, do not speak to any strangers. With any luck Kassandra will know what to do."

Nel nodded and ran out of the room, down the hall, out the door, and back through the gate without looking back. She flew with all her haste to her house, pulled out her pocket spell reference and stuffed some supplies into the satchel. When she was ready, she locked her house with a quick spell and turned to the path that would lead out of the forest and towards Pixie City. She took a deep breath, smiled, and was on her way.
122211222.title: A Quest to Save the Pixies

choices: Nel starts on her journey to the capitol
Meanwhile, Kevin is enjoying his new size
1222112221.content:
Luckily for Nel, Pixie City was finally visible on the horizon. Nel breathed a sigh of relief, glad to finally be close to the city. She had been traveling nonstop since that morning and was almost at the end of her rope. She had had a few scares as well. Not five minutes after getting out of the village she had been attacked by a snake. Nel was quick on her feet though and had managed to throw a confusion spell on the snake before it could use it's own brand of dark magic to hypnotize her. Nel had fleed soon after casting the spell as she knew it would not last long. Things had gone better after that thankfully. But after she had finished a small lunch under an elm tree she had heard strange sounds coming from deep within the forest. Curiosity getting the better of her, she travelled through the trees until she came to a clearing. As soon as she had, she wished she hadn't. Inside the clearing were a pair of goblins each with a large sack. Nel had no doubt these were thieves and they were carrying their wares back to their guild leader. At the time, they had been resting, using the sacks as pillows. Nel quietly managed to sneak away without alerting them to her prescense. Finally she had been flying down the path when she heard laughter. She had thought about investigating, but remembering the goblins, she thought better of it. Unfortunately, she soon found out what had been laughing. A small boy with a pair of tweezers appeared, holding a jar full of various winged insects. Judging by the wingless corpses littering the bottom of the jar and the tweezers clutched in his hands, it didn't take Nel long to figure out what this kid was doing. She had tried once again to escape, but the boy had spotted her and grabbed her. She had struggled futiley as the tweezers inched closer to her wings, thinking her flying days were over. Just before the tweezers could close on her right wing, however, the boy shifted his grip allowing Nel to pull one arm free and perform a quick fire spell that burned the boy's fingers. He dropped her in alarm, allowing Nel to escape.

But it would all be worth it now that she was at Pixie City. She flew up to the gates surrounding the city and held out the letter to the guards. Both were slightly over two feet tall and in her weakened state Nel couldn't help but feel a little intimidated. They didn't say anything about the letter, merely opened the gates and let her pass. Despite her fatigue, Nel was anxious to see every part of Pixie City she could. She had heard stories about the city and seen pictures of it in books but nothing could compare to it's reality. It was a huge city with buildings higher than any Nel had ever seen, the biggest of which was a huge castle, gleaming brightly in the oncoming darkness. Nel quickly flew over next to a building to avoid getting stepped on by the Pixies in the city, most of which were near or over two feet tall. She looked behind her and saw she was leaning against a tavern, one of many in the city. The whole sight and sounds of the city were overwhelming, but Nel was on a mission and quickly made her way to the castle. The castle boasted a huge courtyard though lacked a gate. But then again, Kassandra was the most powerful Pixie in the world. Why would she need a gate to protect her? Of course that meant nothing, now that Kevin could destroy the city in a few footsteps. Remembering her friend, Nel focused on the castle doors and walked inside. Everything within was made of marble, giving the castle an unreal white quality. The floor was made of tiles so brightly polished it was like walking on the feet of her twin. Numerous Pixies were chatting to each other as they walked through the palace on their various duties and the longer Nel looked the more she came to realize that, for all its grandeur, the palace was much like the government building in her own village. Feeling more confident, Nel moved down the biggest hallway she could find and came to a huge ornate door with silver lines sketched across it in a language long since lost to the Pixies. No one knew who built the palace anymore, only that it was a gift to the Pixies to a race long since gone from this world. As such, no one could read the various strange scripts that appeared throughout the castle, though some historians theorized they're instructions left by those who built the palace. Even they could not venture a guess as to what these intstructions might be. Nel pushed open the door, without knowing any of this, and found herself in the throne room of Queen Kassandra.

At the moment she was alone, sitting on her throne, reading a huge book, a small pair of round spectacles over her eyes. Her white dress was long and flowing, with bright stones sewn into the lining so that everytime she moved it appeared as though the dress was twinkling. Her somewhat long reddish hair was pulled back by an ivory circlet that was locked in the center by a sapphire. All the rulers of the Pixie Kingdom wore this gender neautral circlet as a symbol of their power and prestige. As soon as the door closed behind Nel, Kassandra looked up in surprise, removing the spectacles and showcasing her emerald eyes. Her gaze was piercing though, at the moment, only curious.

"Hello child. What brings you to my palace, and how did you get here without appointment?"

Her voice was like music and Nel found herself unable to speak. Kassandra's eyebrow arched and Nel blushed and looked down. She hated feeling so overwhelmed, but Kassandra oozed authority. It didn't help that, even sitting down, Kassandra was staring down at her. Nel took a deep breath and said, "Please your highness. My name is Nel and I've traveled from a far off village with dire news that threatens the entire Pixie Kingdom."

The eyebrow arched, if it was even possible, even higher, but she said nothing. Nel tremblingly held out the letter and Kassandra made a motion with her finger. The letter instantly jumped from Nel's outstretched hand and into Kassandra's own. She put the spectacles back on and slit open the letter. She read the thing quickly, her eyes darting left and right with practiced speed. A frown creased her forehead and Nel thought she could feel the temperature drop. Kassandra looked up from the letter and set it aside. She appeared to be deep in thought. Finally, after Nel was thinking of leaving, she stood up and said, "This is dire news indeed. Follow me child. I am about to show you something that only I, as the Queen of the Pixies, am allowed to know."

Burning with curiousity, Nel watched Kassandra turn to the wall behind the throne and move her arms in an ancient spell casting gesture, one that Nel had never even heard of, let alone practiced. The wall burned bright enough to make Nel see spots and when her vision cleared, it was gone. Kassandra held out her hand and made a light appear in it. Nel did the same and flew after her as she walked down the concealed staircase. Deeper and deeper underground they went until Nel started to truly feel the chill and dampness of the underground. At the bottom of the staircase was a simple wooden door which Kassandra opened and stepped through. The door closed behind them and Kassandra threw the light into the air where it exploded into a million pinpricks of light bathing the room in a starlight glow. Nel saw they were in a large cavern with pictures drawn upon them. Kassandra moved to the first one and said, "This is a prophecy made long ago by the those who created this palace and entrusted it to the Pixies. It was no accident we recieved such a lavish gift. For you see, it was Seen that the Pixie race would give birth to the new world order."

"What do you mean?" Nel asked.

"As Pixies, our power is governed by our sizes and thus, we do not have magic that can alter our sizes. Even I, who am the most powerful Pixie in the world, do not have the power to shrink Kevin or increase another Pixie's size to fight him."

"Then what can we do?" Nel yelled desperately.

"Do not fear child. Each of these pictures tell a story. The building of this palace, the rule of the Pixies, and now, a gigantic figure of a Pixie, one who overcame the boundaries placed at Pixie bright, changing his size."

"You mean Kevin?"

"Yes. Kevin was Seen at the beginning of Pixie rule to be the one who would change the world. For you see, by increasing his size he has gained powers that no Pixie has ever wielded. No other magic user can increase their own power in this way. I fear, even if he doesn't realize it yet, that he can even control his own size. If he ever becomes aware of this knowledge, he could continue to grow in size and power and eventually overthrow the kings who govern this world."

"Would that be so bad?" Nel asked. "Isn't it time Pixies were on top?"

"I can understand your thinking my child. But the prophecy continues. If Kevin does increase his size enough to rule the world, then the balance that was placed at the Beginning of Time will be disrupted and the Universe will become undone."

"But...but..." Nel couldn't think of anything to say. For once, she was speechless.

"Do not fear child. That is only one branch of this prophecy. Another branch says that Kevin will come to his senses and stop his domination scheme before it really can begin. Another branch says that Kevin will be tempted to find a partner to rule with him, but will not choose a close friend. The last branch, says that Kevin will be shrunk back to his normal size and be forgiven his brief trangressions as they were against his power to prevent. I hope to make the final branch come true. As such, I am sending you on a mission to the human capitol, to find the one man who can save us."

"Who is this human?" Nel asked.

"He is only a boy, but his interest in magic specializes in the change of size. To that end, he has been devising a special potion that will shrink any who drink it. I'm afraid an ordinary potion will not suffice as the fruits that Kevin ate were magically altered at their very core. Trust me when I say this boy is the only one who can make this particular potion."

Nel nodded and said, "What does he look like?"

"He is sixteen years old and stands six feet one inch tall. He has short dark brown hair, like and oak tree, and lives alone in the slums of the human capitol. I will supply you with a map, food, drink, and a spell book from the library that will help guide you through the dangers on the way to the capitol. Be stout of heart, my child, as the path ahead of you is long and treacherous. It will take you at least one week to reach the capitol and then the task will fall on you to persuade this boy and take the potion to Kevin and get him to drink it. I ask that you do this because you are closest to him and have the best chance of convincing him to stop this madness he has engaged in. But for tonight, you sleep. When you are recovered, you will go."

And with that, Kassandra led Nel back up to the throne room and had two maids escort her to an empty room. Nel fell asleep almost as soon as her head hit the pillow.

134.content:
As the truck continued on its course, Nel was sleeping silently in the back of it. About two days into the ride, though, the driver got out of his truck and decided to stop at a local fast food place to pick up some food. Nel was still asleep as he proceeded to stop there, unaware of the movements after all the bumping she felt over the last two days. As she was sleeping she felt a weird smell in the air around her, enough to wake her up.

To her surprise it was a human! It was a boy, who looked around 11 or 12. He had light brown hair, green eyes, and couldn’t have been more than 4’11”. He wore a blue, long-sleeve shirt and jeans, and his shoes were black with blue stripes on the sides. The boy looked at Nel with an awe-inspiring look, but the pixie was more annoyed now than scared by his gazing at her.

“Can I help you?” she asked the kid sarcastically.

“I’m sorry”, the boy said to Nel apologetically. “My name’s Anthony. My father and I have been driving in this truck for a couple of days now to drop off some packages to a local laboratory and he stopped to quickly grab some food. I was bored of waiting in the truck, so I walked around and saw you. I haven’t seen a pixie in quite a while!”

“That’s nice”, Nel replied to the kid sarcastically again, proceeding to go back to sleep until she remembered Anthony saying “laboratory”. The pixie quickly flew up to the boy’s face and asked loudly, “Laboratory!?”

“Yep”, Anthony replied. “My father’s a scientist. We’re during this out of favor for one of his colleagues.”

“They don’t happen to know anything that can make objects grow, do they?” Nel asked in anticipation.

“Well…my father WAS carrying an experimental growth formula, but it hasn’t been tested yet”, Anthony told Nel before being cut off. Nel didn’t even wait for Anthony to finish his sentence before she proceeded to look all over the truck for this growth formula. Anthony pointed out that was in his father’s glove compartment, and Nel quickly went in and opened it. Unfortunately the bottle was too big for Nel to lift, so she rushed back to Anthony.

“Would you help me open the growth formula bottle?” Nel asked the boy, pretending to be sad. “It would really make me happy if you do.” Anthony blushed a little at seeing the cute, puppy dog-eyed pixie ask her.

“Okay, but maybe we should until we arrive at the lab tomorrow..”

“No! I want to grow NOW!”

“Okay, Miss Pixie..”, the reluctant Anthony said, taking the bottle from the compartment and placing it on the ground outside of the truck. He then took out a spoon, scooped up some of the liquid, and placed the spoon on the ground next to Nel. The little pixie then proceeded to lick up the drink, feeling a tingling sensation in her body shortly after.

“Miss Pixie, you’re getting bigger”, Anthony said in amazement, looking at the increasingly bigger Nel, who went from 4 inches to now at least a foot high. Does she continue growing?

Nel: "I'd say for you to wait until you can handle it, like when you're 15. I mean, I'm 21 in Pixie years, and believe me, it's just a few years more than Humans... Okay, well, we can live up to 1000 Human years... But what I'm saying is-"

Rio shushed her with her finger, placing it over Nel's mouth.

Rio: "I know what your saying, so that's why you decided to help me, remember?"

Nel: "Well, I did always want to be bigger, both in body and so mega-busty, you know? So I'll be willing to take it. Clare, you stay out of this testing, 'kay?"

Clare: "Okay, Nel, it's your choice."

When they got to Rio's house, the three went over to Rio's lab table. She mixed up a BE potion that would be sure to work. Nel walked up to the vial that contained the mystical liquid, and took a sip to make sure. Just then, her stomach began to rumble and her chest began to feel painful. She shrank down into a small space to keep herself from being looked at directly. She was back there for perhaps five minutes before Clare decided to investigate.


How big does she discover Nel's boobs?
1522.title: Nel's gonna BE big!

Nel took shelter between two books, and Clare was worried due to the length of her absence. Clare took a peek inside, but there was too much shadow to see how big Nel had gotten. When Rio took out the book, it was light enough to see Nel's new endowments, each must've been like 3 inches across, pretty big on a 4-inch pixie lass like her.

Nel: "Don't look at me, I'm a monster! My boobs are humongous!"

Rio: "Yes! My potion works just as I wanted it!"

Clare: "Are you saying you wanted breasts that cover up practically half your body?"

Rio: "So what? I'm obsessed with being the biggest. Comes naturally to someone who's seen bigger boobs than you."

Clare: "But you haven't got any to begin with."

Rio: "Your point being?"

Nel was scared, too scared to be recognized as Nel Nightfall, one who wanted to be big to get Kevin's attention. She then looked to Rio in nervousness, as if she wanted something of her.

Rio: "Nel, you want me to make a growth potion to even out these boobs?"

Nel nodded in cowardess, walking over to another vial with the liquid that would make her big among pixies. She took a sip, and tried to fly over to the nearest shelter, but her boobs anchored her to the table. She felt pain throughout her entire body, feeling like a hundred needles stabbing into her.


How big will she get?
