1532.title: Too late

choices: "...wife!"
"...muse!"
154.content:
"Gotcha!"

If not for her tiny size, the huge palm of the human might have ensnared her. Luckily, Nel's four-inch form slipped through his hand like butter. Flitting her wings to spray off the putrid human sweat, Nel planned her mode of attack. Go around the head and buzz in his ear? Cliche, but do-able. Scratch his eyes out? More effective. Or just flee? The man had to be taught a lesson for messing with a defenseless pixie!

But perhaps the one who should've studied more was Nel, as her conniving left her completely open for capture. This time, the man considered every possible avenue of escape, by sliding her into a black box through a four-inch slit. She barely eased in, so there was no chance of her mustering her way out. As added precaution, the man closed the tiny bar of freedom from Nel, leaving only pinpoint holes to aerate her prison.

"Well, isn't this terrible? I end up captured by a human for thinking too much. Karma, perhaps?"

Nel wasn't one to struggle in this type of situation, just bide her time and wait for opportunity. She tended to wait more often than not. Probably why she hadn't come up with some solution to her diminutive size, yet. Well, that dream was fruitless now. She merely waited in the box, wondering where she might find herself next...

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////// //////////////

Another box, actually. Nel awoke to the sights of slightly larger pinpricks for a ceiling, but the same dull, pitch black surroundings. Perhaps a bit more spacious, but no opening in sight. The walls dwarfed her even more than the last box, and she found herself a helpless prison. Kneeling over in anguish, she almost missed the overshadowing eye peeking through the top. Instantly she sprung up to reach at it, but the human moved away.

"Alive! Wow, a real, living pixie! And everyone told me I was a fraud... I'll show them, won't I? Me and my new..."
154.title: Snatched!

choices: And a steady growth begins...
Nothing happens, how disappointing.
And she shoots up!
1542.content:
Wife?! Nel wasn't exasperated to hear that... What was he planning on doing with a four-inch bride? Unless...

"You up there! Hey, you!"

Her tiny voice failed to carry to his large and cumbersome ears. Hopelessly minute hearing... She tried hollering at the top of her lungs, but to no avail. All she could do was watch him peek around at her, trying to glance at whatever he could behold of her figure. Flustered, Nel tried to concoct some way out of this trap. Banging on the ceiling seemed to help. He immediately took note, and gripped the box with both hands.

"What is it, my lovely prize? Have you something to say? You can tell me."

If only humans weren't deaf...

"Ours will be such a happy life, if you just trust in me. And I'll never have to step foot in the rotten village ever again, we can enjoy our lives together in the pleasing shade of the trees. No one will ever find me here... What with your magic, and the assistance of the witch, I should find myself in a very pleasing position!"

Nel wondered. Just how does he aim to take her? Then, she recalled his mention of the witch. So old Kathrin Keebler had brewed up this nonsense? True, her magic was strong, but what could be done to make a pixie the fitting wife for a human? Suddenly, it struck her. She gasped in delight.

Could she finally get her wish, thanks to this fool?

"Well, my darling, the witch advised me to sprinkle you once daily, so that our love may grow as gradually as you will. But, I'm eager to see you in all your beauty, so I'll add just a bit more than recommended... It can't hurt, the witch deals only in good magic, now."

Nel sunk to the bottom of the box. Sprinkles? She'd be trapped in this prison, fed on bits of magic dust. The thought didn't excite her, even considering the potential growth. Old Kathrin had been known to be wrong, too. The foolish mortal shook the canister once, raining a glittery mist in through the holes. Droplets collected on Nel's feet...
1542.title: Pulled Into Marriage

choices: She tries to escape.
She decides to play along.
15423.content:
Then the moisture spread to her legs, hands, arms, then torso and neck. The dewdrops graced the tip of her nose and the middle of her lips, ever so gently dripping off the ends of her hair from the top of her head. Covered in whatever miraculous powder this might be, the hope of growth filled Nel's body with anticipation. Her toes writhed and her hands quivered. Her tiny abdomen shook. Only a moment now, only a moment...

Yes, it only took a second! From four inches, she bolted up through five, six, ten! Cramped within the confines of her black prison, she pushed her larger, stronger arms against it. The growth continued, and strength proportional to her new size, surpassing a whole foot and a half. At last reaching two feet, her squished form shattered the four walls of her imprisonment, opening her up to a brighter, yet bigger world.

Unfortunately, there her growth halted. She stood at two feet tall, barely below the chest of her captor. For the first time, she could glance up at him and examine his features. To her dismay, he was just a youth! A boy of no more than seventeen, naive to the world at large. Her own age surpassed his, a shocking discovery. What was he doing, growing pixies for his bride? Wasn't there some stupid human girl he could marry and unhappily settle down with?

"My! I never expected this to happen... I'll have to get you a new cage, so that you don't run away before I can make you the proper size. The witch was right, once a day is the only way to go."

"No! Please, don't imprison me again!"

She was glad to finally reach his ears; being taller meant a more human frequency. Though she could tell, the quality was still hypnotizing to a mortal. How perfect.

"I wouldn't dream of it, now. I thought you couldn't speak!"

"Of course I can speak. Every creature can speak, it's just a matter of understanding the language."

"Yours is a truly beautiful one."

He lovingly glanced upon her; she coyly shielded herself in response. With an outstretched hand, he tried to hold her, but instinct had control of Nel this time. She nipped his hand. The boy recoiled in pain, but without anger.

"I see. You will have to stay here longer, if we're to control that."

"Don't force yourself upon me! I don't take kindly to larger things striking me."

"Oh! I never intended you any harm... I haven't caused you any, have I?"

His ignorance was utterly unbearable. Nevertheless, she thanked him silently for giving her that perfect opportunity to grow. Though not the tallest of the pixies, Nel's stature would dwarf most of them. If she could escape now, that world of bragging rights would be open to her.

But, then again, she was clever. With a little more time, she could become the tallest pixie to ever live. Never before had one reached the height of a human, after all. Her mind oozed with the possibilities. Did she want to be grateful for the growth she'd already received, or was the lust for more height overpowering?
15423.title: Better Size, Bigger Idiot

choices: Nel pushes for more dew.
Nel avoids taking more dew.
154232.content:
"Oh, no, you haven't hurt me at all... I'm just a little nervous, is all."

The boy sighed with relief. Completely at her mercy. Abusing this power to grow even larger would be simple, all that was needed was flawless execution.

"Whatever caused me to grow this way? It's a magic that's unknown to me."

"Ah! That'd be the kindly old witch's work. I told her that I could not marry in the village, as all of the women there were idle, dull, and unbecoming. I wanted a wife with spark, someone clever and intelligent, as well as beautiful. She smiled upon me, and told me to look for a wife in the forbidden forest. But, as the legend goes, none but pixies live there. Knowing this, she offered me this power, a type of ancient dew collected from a now-extinct animal who produces it naturally. The dew, she said, would allow my wife to meet my eyes and thus kiss me. Eager for such a happy companion, I gladly obliged her whatever she wished."

"Which was?"

"Oh, the... perhaps it's better if I don't tell you."

Nel had a bad feeling about this.

"But, there I was in the woods, searching for what I thought would only be myth. Yet there you slept on a log, the most immaculate creation I'd ever witnessed... I fell immediately, and knew that I had to have you for my wife."

"That's a touching compliment..."

His statements were cringe-worthy. Humans. Always needing what they shouldn't have, witches letting them get away with it. A part of her wondered if old Kathrin had singled her out for this treatment. The two conversed regularly, with Nel always desperate for her to whip up some growth concoction. (Witches can speak with mythical creatures, as they have a much larger hearing range and a much better vocabulary) She wouldn't put it past her.

"I'm so glad you found me! I was miserable at my tiny height. Now that I am two feet tall, I am among the tallest of my kind. I thank you, but..."

"It's not enough?"

"I only wish that I might sooner stand beside you... Is there no way I can be sprinkled with more?"

"I don't know, the witch strongly suggested I wait. Something about the after-effects, but I can't remember."

Had old Kathrin known full well that Nel would be the pixie of choice, she would have advised the human involved to punish her with agonizing slow growth. The two enjoyed playing tricks on each other, after all. And, what's more, the witch hadn't even spoken to Nel of her fortunate discovery. So, who's to say the restriction wasn't another way of keeping Nel from her goals?
154232.title: To Become A Bride?

choices: Nel tells Jaden about herself.
Some 'after-effects' begin to occur.
1542322.content:
...On the other hand. There's no way the witch would be able to control what a human had done in the forest short of some extremely powerful concoction- and Nel was pretty sure even Kathrin was not capable of a feat so great. So if Kathrin had warned about after-effects, it'd likely be best to heed them... besides, Nel waited this long to grow, she could wait a few more days.

"Well, I do think avoiding after-effects would be for the best..."

"Understandable. Hard to marry someone when they're dead, right?"

"...Right."

"Besides this gives us some time to get to know each other better! I'd like to know about my wife to be. Even someone as stunningly beautiful as your ut-"

Great. More Compliments.This guy didn't know when to quit.

"You can call me Nel."

"Oh. Right! I didn't even know your name! Nel... that's a beautiful name. Truly fitting of-"

"And yours?"

"Oh, right! Jaden's my name- but you can call me Jay if you want."

"Sure Jay. Why don't you tell me more about yourself."

------------------------------------------------------

Asking that question was a mistake. Nel couldn't believe a human could talk so long without breathing. Once he was finished there was very little about the man Nel Didn't know- Son of a baker in the nearby village, he was always attracted to the supernatural. Because of it, everyone thought he was strange, he left to avoid the ridicule, and well, here they are.

"So, that's a little bit about me. How about you?"

"Well..."
1542322.title: Better Safe than Dead.

Nel had finally reached the source of the glow. By now she was so deep under water that everything around her was pitch black. She reached out her hand to touch the light. As she felt it, she noticed a strange scaly texture. It was like that of a fish. "Aha!" screamed Nel as she picks up a fish bone. "Maybe if I poke the fish's stomach, the angler fish will spit me out!" Nel examined the fish bone, standing near the side of the stomach, positioning herself strategically.

"Great just great this place comes with a new outfit" groaned Nel


Nel took off walking down the hall then came to a room... A large room to Nell. Things were just slightly larger than the average human belongings whilst Nel was normal size.

The room had a grandfather clock a few odds and ends but noticeably no doors or windows.
Also there was a round table made of oak in the center. The tiny pixie was about to turn around when she noticed a slice of chocolate cake on a plate under the table.she made her way over to it.


"Huh how odd to leave this out. Oh well I am getting hungry"

With that she began to nibble at the part with frosting. After 3 bites Nel began to feel strange. She took a few steps away from the cake and table with her hands on her stomach. The strange feeling grew stronger and stronger until Nel started growing clothes and all.

15532111.content:
Nel enjoyed how big she was, so she ate the rest of the cake. Soon enough, a tingling sensation covered her entire body as she started to grow in size. The floor started to sink below her as her body shoot up.

"Yes, this is great! I want more!"

Her head soon bumped against the ceiling, forcing her to sit down as her body continued to expand without pause. The glass table was knocked off, shattering against the floor as the room started running out of space.

"Looks like I overdid it a little... But it sure feels great to be this big. But what shall I do now?"

info.brief_description: What happens when a Pixie get’s fed up with her size?
info.description:
Nel’s a Pixie, she, like most pixies, are small, but in the eyes of pixies she’s small, only standing at 4 inches tall Nel longs to get bigger. Unlike other pixies wearing blue or green dresses, Nel wears a blood red one, she had blue hair with some red fringes.
Nel’s kind and sarcastic at times, like most other pixies she’s very impish and likes to play about with people.

In this story we’ll follow Nel in her quest to get bigger, although things may not go the way she plans them to.

As for the world, it’s modern times although with some fantasy things added, like magic, mythical creatures. Most people live in cities or villages, not many live alone out of fear that something might attack them.

Nel’s home is in a Pixie village at the centre of a forest, the pixies there are lead by whoever has the most magic and there for whoever’s the biggest, seeing how the bigger the pixie the more magic it has.

Nel’s forest is close to a poor village which doesn’t have much technology, most people travel around on horses because of this. Also close to her forest is a mythical forest which has a ban on anyone going into it.

Other Characters:
Name ~ Race ~ Gender ~ Height ~ Hair ~ Other info

Kevin ~ Pixie ~ Male ~ 10” ~ Striate brown ~ Nel has a small crush on him, and he has feeling for Nel, although they don’t know how the other feels.

Clare ~ Pixie ~ Female ~ 1’7” ~ Long blonde ~ Nel’s friend who’s cleaver despite what she looks, she’s tall in the Pixie world and like making people aware of this.

Josh ~ Pixie ~ Male ~ 1’10” ~ Messy black ~ The ruler of the pixie village Nel and her friends Kevin and Clare life in.

Kassandra ~ Pixie ~ Female ~ 2’8” ~ Long ish Red ~ Current Queen of the pixies, she lives at the Pixie city.

Raziel ~ God ~ Raziel has no given form, but he is the god of size and shape.

Kathrin ~ Human ~ Female ~ 51'3" ~ Very long strait silver ~ Witch that lives in the forbidden forest.


More characters will be added when used in the story.
